text: Awesome pour with a nice rocky head. Cloudy orange in color with bright carbonation. Aromas are out of control with pepper, lemon, piney hops, and the classic bubblegum yeast. The taste follows with bright citrus up front followed by some musty hops and an effervescence that carries the flavors away. Its both what I imagined a imperial weizen to be and at the same time it is completely without boundaries. Very good!

Nicely done. Some citrus and a hint of smoke. Some light sugary malt and a little booze. Pours hazy orange with decent head and some floaties. Light sweet finish with some malty tang. Nice stuff, and great for style. Touch of banana. Bottle thanks to arminjewell.
Smell was hoppy with mild banana and pineapple notes. Taste was mild hops, alcohol, and the usual weizen notes. Tastes like someone spilled an IPA into a hefeweizen.

Unbelievably good. Not generally wiezen fan but this one takes it to new level. Huge cloves loved that characteristic, no real banana which is perfect. Some lemon some yeast and dough. Big ABV but not noticeable. I. Flavor that is, did get me pretty buzzed.

12oz. bottle from brewery. Aroma of clovey spice, banana, lemon citrus, some herbal and floral tinges, lemongrass, slight pepper, some wheat grain and faint honey. Cloudy, dark golden in color with an exceedingly foamy, sticky, lasting head, off-white, with lacing to match. Flavor profile is strongly yeasty, plenty of spice, esters, pepper, dough, etc. with some lemon citrus, very faint sweetness, breadiness, as well as some medicinal alcohol present late. Mouthfeel is highly effervescent, warming and active, gently acidic and features a nicely full body. Interesting and tasty.

12oz bottle poured into a pint glass and shared with Kristy K at the condo. Hazy orange with a thin off-white head but excellent lacing. Aroma is yeast, wheat, clove, green apple, bubblegum, and citrus. Taste is classic hefeweizen with clove, banana, and bread sweetness plus some citric hoppy bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, boozy and phenolic on the finish.

"6/09-the hops werent what i was hoping for in this imperial dry hopped weizen, but i see the last review for this bad boy was some time ago, so maybe they were there and have since died a long slow death? still a good beer, but based on the hoppy Crackd Wheat, I wanted more out of this. It was more yeasty and sweet with the hops barely making an appearance in the back. Some sediment, great full mouthfeel, fruity, cloves, big flavor, but didnt detect the nearly dbl digit alcohol. not bad, but i was maybe more excited than i should have been."
(bottle) hazy amber gold with huge head. Aroma of spice, clove and pine. Flavor is wheat malt, a little clove, yeast and piney hops.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with huge pillowy white head that leaves tons of lacing. Nose is clove, coriander and a bit of funk. Lots of carbonation in the mouthfeel. Bock sweetness comes through in the taste. Leaves my lips and tongue numb!

These guys never cease to amaze me. In a style that I was expecting much out of, they made a great beer. Poured a hazy darker yellow to orange with a white head. Aroma was of funky apples, wheat, lemons, and toast. Flavor was light funky oakyness, apples and lemons and some berries too. Very unique and tasty.

Pours a pretty cloudy gold with a huge white head that lasts and lasts. Nose is of bubblegum, cloves, coriander, citrus and apricots. Very creamy and smooth on the palate with a rich and creamy viscosity. Flavor is full of many different tastes: spices including cinnamon, coriander, cloves, with fruits including citrus, apricots and bananas, some sweet malt, some yeastiness followed by a suggestion of hops, all warmed by its 9.25% ABV. This beer may be enjoyed as a banquet unto itself and may be enjoyed with a variety of foods but most especially light cheeses or white meats.

Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a lightly hazy dark yellow with 3 fingers of thick white head that just lasts and lasts. Aroma of clove, dank wheat, citrus. Taste is light sweet and follows aroma. Good beer. Different, and not what I was expecting, but very good.

Big "fizz" when I opened the bottle...Way over-carbonated, waited 5 minutes for the head to dissipate. Although I have to say this pours a beautiful dark rich orange. Sunset in a glass, it is almost glowing. What a rich aroma, cinnamon spice, strawberries, fresh summer fruit, honeydew melon. The flavor is unfortunately not as rich as the aroma. Musty burlap bag and a strong vegetal bitterness paired with some apple tartness. Strangely incohesive. Nice effort but off the mark.
Clove, cinnamon, wheat, and floral notes from the hops are on the aroma. Citrusy and spicy on the palate. Nice mouthfeel to this one, chewy, yet smooth.

Bottle: Thanks, Ryan! Almost fully opaque, dense golden-orange body; super volatile, long-lasting, chunky eggshell cap rests on top for days & leaves generous lacing behind. You can definitely smell the hops in the aroma; big citrus peel & floral notes all over. Lots of hefe yeast, spiced & heavy with notes of sweet bubblegum, coriander, clove, rotten banana, melon, bread, & a light bit of pears & green apple in the finish. Taste is quite spicy & certainly yeast forward... Coriander, clove, lighter notes of cinnamon & white pepper, toasty malts, baked bread, banana & fruity esters with a semi-sweet back-end resembling salt water taffy. Hops are lighter but still give a floral & herbal flavor in the finish along with a mild note of tart apples. Big, chunky, relatively chewy body, the alcohol is hidden quite well here. Though I prefer Dancing Man, this is really a very nice "imperial hefeweizen".

Thanks tectactoe. Pours a golden orange color with a big fluffy head. Really good aroma of hops and zesty citrus with candy like smells. Big bubblegum flavor upfront and throughout. Hop tingle left on the tongue. Very carbonated. I liked it.

12oz bottle thanks to some joker. Note: this is the unplugged version, not the thumbprint version. Pours a very murky light amber with almost no head. Aromas of dirty rotten fruit, some spices. Taste is sweet and sticky. Flavors of rotten apple, hot garbage. Finishes on a note of sweet dumpster juice. This is among the worst beers Ive ever had.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with head for days. Aroma is a slightly caramel peach with a slight spice profile. Taste is again fruit forward with a lingering sweetness. Slight bubblegum in a good way and no hint of the 9+% alcohol. Great NG beer as usual.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Pour is hazed deep amber with a tight off white head leaving a thick lace. Nose is interesting, a lightly muddled wheat malt and spicy earthy yeast note give way to lemon and clove with a touch of candied lemon. There is a bit of an herbal back end. Taste has a lot happening, the wheat malt is up front, its earthy and musky. The yeast is quite spicy mingling with the candied lemon and some sweetness through the finish. Well carbonated, spice lingers, peppery. Body is full and creamy, faint dryness and a bit sweet through the finish.
Another great entry in the Thumbprint line from New Glarus. Strength is the predominant word here.

Pours a hazy golden with 4 finger head that lingers, but no lacing. Yeast and funk hit the nose up front. Hint of bubble gum and banana, but very subtle. Pine and grapfruit hops. Toasted malt. I can appreciate a little clove. Starts out thinking it wants to be sweet, but then turns moderately bitter. Long bitter finish. Full bodied and moderately carbonated. This is very good
Nice white foamy head and fairly clear wuth a bit of haziness. Nice hop presence with the base of a bready hefe. Really nice beer!

Bottle from a generous friend. Pours a hazy orange yellow with a massive creamy and fluffy white to off-white head. The head just wont quit! Beautiful fruit medley of banana, pear, bright citrus, spicy earthy funky yeast, floral notes of hibiscus and jasmine, and even what smells like some dank hops. This is beautiful, really incredible nose. The flavor is big florals and zesty hops up front followed by sweet pears and orange citrus, then finishing with a funky banana yeasty ness. There is significant zest to this in front of what seems to be a nice hefe and the combination is both unique and deliciously refreshing. Medium body with medium high carbonation and loads of complex flavors. New Glarus does it again. I could drink this all day and there is no sign of the 9%+ ABV anywhere. This one could get dangerous.

01/07/14 trade from Jamil. Home on a snow day. Sour grapefruit scent with some malt. Beautiful cloudy copper pour with a big head. Medium feel. Sour hop citrus flavor to a tinge of funk quality and ending on a malt note. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy golden orange color with a sticky one finger head. Good soapy lacing with this. 
Massive amount of fruit. Yeah the usual clove and banana but add in stone fruit pits and pineapple. Really impressive nose with this. 
Sharp tropical fruit bite in the taste. Off the bat hoppy. Backing of clove and banana with stone fruits. 
Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Slightly sweet and sticky. Has the body of an IPA but the feel of a wheat. Lovely beer
Watch out for the nigh-unstoppable head. Look is a swampy dull-orange with lots of bubbles. Taste is sweet, fizzy, fruity and floral. Love this stuff.
Pours cloudy golden yellow with a white head. The nose mostly sweet with notes of banana and clove. The flavor is fairly boozy with some spice and residual sweetness.

Bottle - gift from friend. Sour wheat malt, spice, and alcohol aroma. Hazy honey gold with a large off-white head. Banana, clove, slightly sour wheat, and alcohol flavor. Medium body, soft carbonation. I suspect this bottle was past its prime, but it was still way too boozy for my personal taste.

Bottle (12 oz). Extra from Mark, thanks! Hazy golden/amber with a huge fully lasting frothy white head and good lacing. Aroma is of spices (mostly cloves and cinnamon), banana, alcohol, bubblegum and herbal notes. Taste is moderately sweet with cloves, cinnamon, alcohol, wheat, banana and herbal notes. Alcohol is not hidden. Full bodied. Moderate carbonation. Spicy/dry mouthfeel. I think this is too much. Quite complex, but too heavy, not easily drinkable and with too much alcohol presence.

Hazy Amber Orange Color, Huge Long Lasting Foamy Head, Lots Of Thick Lacing. Nice Mild Floral Hop Aroma. Floral Pine Hop Bite Up Front, Fruity, Sweet Malt, Resin Finish. Medium Body, Creamy, Smooth. Since I did Not Get any Wheat, It Reminds Me of A Double IPA. Nice. Really Easy To Drink, Would Never Guess this packs 9.25% Punch. Enjoyed. Good Stuff. Recommended...

Bottled August 15, 2013.
Appearance: The body is completely hazy with an golden-amber hue. The head erupts from the body to form a tall and dense white head that maintains its shape for a long time.
Aroma: The aroma is fruity with a grapefruit presence that has a sweet edge to it, straw and lemon come to mind after with a clean floral presence and a sweet banana backing. The aroma leans a tad sweet and is far more complex than I am giving it credit for. Good strength as well. Edit: Perhaps some pineapple here.
Taste: The intro is an odd mix of mildly bitter grapefruit and sweet banana. The two flavors clash, slightly, through into the mid-taste where straw and lemon come to mind. The finish become a bit floral, a tad chalky, and a bit clovey. The finish lingers of chalk, grapefruit and floral dryness. The finish is semi-dry.
Palate: Full-bodied, creamy and mildly carbonated.
Overall: This is an odd assortment of flavors, but I enjoy it. I have drank almost the whole bottle while writing this review, it is immensely drinkable especially at 9.25% abv. This is a great beer, well done.

Pours medium cloudy, pale yellow. Not much head. Very strong hops aroma. Texture is rich, round. Theres a lot of burn from the alcohol, quite warming going down. Not sweet, not bitter. Lots of citrus flavor.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2014 Dull orange/amber color; minimal creamy head. Lively carbonation. Aroma of citrus and hops. Alcoholic taste with lots of fruity body. A bit sharp on the aftertaste.

Bottle with thanks to RobertDale! Pours cloudy orange amber with a huge puffy off-white head that lasts forever and leaves a lot of clumpy lacing. Aroma is wheat, lemon, pine, clove, citrus. Flavor is dry and strong, almost vinous with wheat, lemon, lemon zest, a bit of pine sol, just a tiny bit of clove. Lingering zesty bitterness, and almost gets a little sweeter on the finish. Mouthfeel is rich and heavily carbonated, with some ABV burn action going on, but not too bad. Definitely scores some points for originality!
Bottle pours hazy orange with thick massive head. Aroma is clove and spices, taste is thick slightly sweet body and spicy, nice beer

Spicy clove smell with a hint of cherry. Lots of aroma. Poured cloudy with a lot of head. Very flavorful beer. I don?t like clove in my beers, but oddly I do here. This beer is vert tart, but I think the clove and hints of cinnamon spice balance it out nicely. Im very impressed by this beer. Wow!

Bottle. Spice and alcohol on the nose and some doughines. Cloudy yellow with a pillowy white head. A lot of lace. Tastes like a big weizen. Clove, banana and other spices with a bready, yeasty flavor and some alcohol. Medium to heavy body. A great beer.
12 ounce bottle Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of yeast, spice, and fruit. Taste is yeast, banana, citrus, clove, cinnamon, and wheat. Very good.

23rd June 2013Cloudy gold beer with a tidy off white head. Palate is crisp and semi dry. Smooth malt, not particularly wheaty. Smooth orange and a touch of lemon. Malt cream with a touch of peppery spice. A pleasant mellow brandy tone. Finishes dry. Hangs together well, very drinkable.

Great example of an Impy Weisen. Clove and a hint of pineapple maybe a bit of corriander. Very good brew!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Gold with an enormous off white head. Boozy clove and fruit aromas. Fruity and astringent.
Bottle shared by Ryan - thanks!! Glad to try this one. Hazy orange pour with a huge white head. Hops, clover and banana in the nose. Really nice, different and yummy.

12 oz bottle.

Aroma is citrus, floral, and spice. Pours a light copper with a huge frothy head overflowing my pint glass. Flavor is banana up front but a thoroughly hopped finish with mild pine notes. Moderately sticky body.

Solid, but now as good as I remember it as an Unplugged beer back in the day.
Its a german hefe, but stronger and fuller. Lots of banana and a touch of spice. Hides the 9+% very well.

Aroma of bubble gum, spices, some citrus. Hints of pine in the background but very faint. Orange in color, huge white head, Very complex flavor...but it explodes. Smooth sweetness with steady bitterness right behind. The typical sweetness of a hefe is muted nicely, followed by nice warming of high alcohol. Cinnamon, spices, and fruit hit from all directions. Finishes with a sharp bitterness that ends nicely and dry.

12 oz bottle. 2273. (Rileys) Madison, WI.
Hazy orange golden colour with a huge fluffy off-white head. 
Amazing aroma of wheat, yeast, pineapple, caramel and banana. Wow! Absolutely delicious! 
The flavour aint bad either. This is so good. Extremely tasty. 
Wheat, yeast, caramel sweetness, malt, sweet fruits, mild sourness and mild bitterness.
Very balanced and super tasty. One of the best beer for some time.

Bottle from Casanovas, nice golden orange pour with a big fluffy lasting white head. Aroma is some clove from the yeast but some nice citrus notes too. Taste is somewhat pineapple/mango, some maltiness, nice bitterness, little sting to the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, hops and pine needles.
Sweet and fruity flavour of hosp and pine needles with notes of citrus peel.
Hoppy finish.

12 oz. bottle. Pours hazy gold orange with a large soapy head that slowly settles. Aroma has citrus a lot of florals and some nice malt biscuit. Taste is bitter citrus hops nice floral flavor and lemon/orange rind and bready yeast. Palate is thin to medium and fizzy with a drying finish. Very good!
bottled. amber coloured. unclear. dense beige head. aroma. sweetness, wheaty, yeast, fruits. flavour. light citric, sweetness, yeast, fruits. medium to full bodied. ends yeasty, citric and sweet.

Aroma is citrus, bananas, spices and super-sized/strong bubble gum. The flavor is citrus, fruit, light bananas, strong bubble gum, mild hop resin and a bitter and tangy finish. Not really that similar to weizenbocks Ive had, this really was an imperial hefe, not sure that I will find another, pretty good.

12 oz bottle served in a Kuhnhenn snifter. Picked some up fresh from across the border.

A: Pours a dark orange color with a hazy body. Two fingers of thick, pure white head form on the pour with excellent retention. As it slowly goes down the glass it leaves sticky clings of heavy lace.

S: Big yeasty notes on the nose. Clove and banana with a nice sweetness to it. The malts are bread and sweet through out and the hops really come out at the end with a nice fruity kick.

T: The taste follows the nose. The nice hefe yeast profile of sweet cloves and banana, the sweet wheat with a little bid of white bread and then the nice fruity hop profile on the finish. Slightly bitter as well.

M: Medium to light bodied with a medium carbonation level thats trending towards the high end. The finish is slightly bitter and drying.

O: Very delicious and much better than the previous Unplugged batch. Dan outdid himself with this one. Ill be picking up more of this.

Serving type: bottle

09-20-2013

Pours straw yellow with a huge monster of a white frothy head. Aroma is full of clove, grass, grapefruit, and sweet orange. Sweet but a hoppy slight tang flavor. Finishes crisp and makes for an overall delicious beer

Fresh. 2013 release. Pours a cloudy, straw yellow/orange. Huge, fluffy, creamy white head, lasting with some drapes of lace. Aroma is complex and bursting with character; hops, citrus, lemon, grapefruit, wheat, banana, clove. Flavor follows. Medium to full body. Creamy. A little oily. Sweet. Fruity. A fair amount of spices. Alcohol content? What alcohol content? Hardly any there. Hop character really makes an impression and complements the hefe qualities nicely. Great balance. Pleasant finish. Smooth, absurdly drinkable, and absolutely delicious.

Strong, beautiful aroma. A lot of wheat and hops, citrus, spices, a little grapefruit.
Taste is way sweeter and creamier than expected. Hops, a little bitter finish. Yet smooth, citrus, spices.

This fantastic bold beer has great color and smell. A first class Weizen. The taste is completely unique though. It starts off like a first class hefeweizen and then finishes like an APA. A truly unique and great beer! Probst!

Hazy dark gold color with the foamiest head Ive even seen on a beer and tons of lacing. Aroma of wheat, citrus, cinnamon, cloves, spices and bananas. Flavor is wheat, citrus hops, cloves, pale malts, and a resiny aftertaste; Bit boozy. Body is light and carbonation is non-existent. A bit boozy in flavor but quite good otherwise.
12oz to nonic. Cloudy. Slightly darker weiss appearance. Big pillowy head. Fresh hops on the nose. Fresh hoppy flavor. Subtle weiss characteristics. Delicious. Potent.
Bottle shared at some tasting a million years ago. Sweet rich banana vanilla notes, pudding, dessert. Really tasty but too sweet not to share.
Pours a hazy gold with some spicey cloves and light wheat, grain. Flavor has been definitely hurt by age. But not bad considering.

Bottle sent in a trade forgot who sent this my way. Pour has a dark amber color and even with careful pouring and leaving a good inch or more of crud there is still quite a bit of floating particles. Aroma has quite a bit of oxidation from age though I have no idea of the true date. Fruits, sweetness, yeast, thick wheat, aged hops, and some pepper. Truly strange even if this is over aged. Mouth feel is medium light and there is a light carbonation. Flavor has yeast, hefty wheat, aged hops, and some spice. This is clearly over aged and I will rate it to average to be fair but the brewer was clearly right in saying "Dont bother waiting to enjoy - the time is now"
12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy gold. White spritzy foam. Dry spicy clove aroma. Some in the taste as well. A little past its prime, but still nice.

Pours a cloudy amber orange color with a large fluffy cream colored head of foam on it. Scent is heavy with wheat and sweet citrus. Taste is really full of flavor for a Hefeweizen with complex wheat mixed nicely with coriander and a slight lemon zest. Quite a heavy hitter for a Hefeweizen but rather well made as per usual with New Glarus beers!

Bottle from trade. Holy shit, this one takes you for a ride... Aromas on this are honey, clove, cinnamon, lemon, and wheat. Flavors pop from the aroma in your mouth. Just an excellent and unique beer. I want more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike.

The beer is cloudy and straw yellow hued with an inch of dense, white head. The aroma offers a healthy serving of banana, with some wheat And lemons coming in behind. The flavor does not live up to the promise of the aroma. A bit soapy, and alcohol presence, which was absent in the aroma, asserts itself in the flavor profile. Lemon zest and window cleaner. Not horrible, but also not a repeat for me. Medium bodied with an odd astringency. Aventinus is still the go to weizenbock for me.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-08-2012

Bottle from B&B in Wind Lake. Had some dust on it, and very few ratings since May, so likely old. Shrug? Pours a pale orange with a white head. Aroma has fruit, straw and spices. Taste is of sweet fresh fruit, bread, spices and has some earthiness. Finishes tangy and sweet, with some spice and with some length. Nice body. One I would have liked to have while fresher.

12 oz. bottle, sent from FullObs (thanks a lot, Brett), pours a beautiful cloudy faded orange with a small white head. Aroma is full of banana, clove and wheat, with some milder citrus undertones. Flavour brings out cinnamon and clove on top, fairly unusual for a hef, at least the cinnamon notes, with citrus and banana coming in later on. Finishes on light spicy notes (from the cinnamon) and citrus. ABV is not noticeable at all, except in maybe making this feel like a bigger beer. Not a traditional hef by any means, but very enjoyable - a refreshing, easy-drinking near-10% beer.
Bottle.  Pours cloudy orange with thick off white head.  The nose is a strange slightly funky yeast, tangerine.  Taste is fresh juicy pineapple, manderine orange with slight notes of wit yeast funk.

12 oz. bottle.  Poured a hazy golden orange with white fluffy head that left splotches of lace.  Flavor of sweet candi sugar, bread, yeast, bananas, and cloves.   Finished dry and peppery with cinnamon and nutmeg notes.  Medium bodied.  Tremendously complex.  Kind of like a heavy  hefe that finishes like a Belgian IPA. Wish I picked up more of this in WI.

A very clean, deep yellow/golden pour, great bubbly white head and a modest amount of cascading bubbles within the brew. I cannot emphasize the inviting aroma of this beer. Sweet notes of wheat and clove hit the nose first with some mild citrus and flowery presence later. Not overly sweet nor overly spiced. Flavor has a very strong citrus orange and lemon combination with strong notes of clove in the middle and finishes up with a wheat and light alcohol bite. Surprisingly the hefe style as an imperial holds up very well. Body lacks the yeasty mouth feel but the beers density replaces that feeling very well. Overall a great offering by NG. As far as imperials go, its very well balanced as all flavor/aromas can be detected individually.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

Imperial Weizen pours a mildly hazy pale straw color with a very large fluffy white head that leaves a sheet of lace down the side of the glass.  

There is a ton of coriander and banana in the nose, with milder wheat and tangy citrus notes.

The flavor is full and bold, at least by Hefe standards.  The requisite wheat, coriander, and banana are present up front.  Although it starts sweet, a tangy grapefruit citrus note starts building and creates a slight hoppy presence toward the end of the sip.  The finish is pleasantly clean.

Considering this is a 9.6% Hefeweizen, this is impressively balanced and actually a little bit dry.  The start of the sip is fairly sweet, but by the end it is barely noticeable.  The carbonation is creamy and crisp at the same time, and it works with the beers flavor.

I was impressed that this did not get syrupy or cloying given the high ABV, but Hefes definitely have a ceiling in my book.

Pours unclear lemon orange in color with a decent off white head. The aroma brings bready yeast and sweet notes, with a bit of lemon in there. The flavor of sweet yeast and bready wheat style notes on a thicker but palatable body make this beer quite delicious for the style.

hazy gold with a dense white head. clingy full body with high carbonation.

aroma: bright tart wheat, bitter orange, citrusy hops, green banana, apple, alcohol, and some spicy yeast notes. somewhere between Vitus, Orval, and an imperial wit.

taste: tart wheat and bitter orange dominate; backed by notes of banana, apple, citrusy hop bitterness, pale malt sweetness, nutmeg, and alcohol warmth. there are occasional, subtle hints of plastic, common in hefe-weizen, but none of the smokey or rubbery phenols.

very complex and intriguing; combining the best qualities of Orval with the best qualities of weizenbock, with a little panache of its own.

Bottled.  Thanks to adnielsen for the bottle.  Strong clove and citrus aroma.  Clove, citrus, yeast, alcohol flavors.  This beer is exactly like it sounds, an IMPERIAL weizen.  Personally, I like the less in your face flavor of a normal german hefeweizen compare to this imperial weizen.  This beer is kind of barley winish.  Interesting as an experimental beer.

In bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a thick beige head that dies down to a fair cap after a few minutes. The aroma is a little shocking at first. Sour notes balanced with a whack of banana and cloves. Then juicy Cascade hops kick in before a white pepper finish. Flavour-wise, there is an immediate bitter orange flavour before bananas and a sour linger. Moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Really interesting.

Originally reviewed: 3/16/12. 12oz bottle, poured into a tall weizen glass. From scanning the reviews, this one looks like its at least 8 months old. 

Pours a cloudy amber-tinted dark gold. A huge frothy white head tops er off. The first aroma that hits me is a big smack of floral hops. Wow. That was unexpected. [After reading the label on the bottle, I now see this was a dry-hopped weizen - very cool]. The more I pull at this one, the expected aromas creep through - clove, banana bread, cinnamon. 

The body is on the scant side, as it goes down quite slick. The massive head scored some of the carbonation away, no doubt. Alcohol, though higher, is barely detected in the flavor. Subtle hints of ethanol on the back end. Mild citrus flavors meld well with the faint hoppiness, and lightly-tart sourdough bread quality. 

A decent brew that I would like to have again, but itd need to be in a much fresher form for sure.

Bottle pours like a gold color reminds me of grapefruit juice color. Smell banana breat citrus. Not bad taste thicker small carb on tongue. Tastes about same as it smells with the cinnamon flavor coming thru and other spices. Not a bad beer maybe really good for style I just dont know it well? Reminds me of a home brew taste nothing over top just a straight forward beer.

From bottle.  Pours 24k gold with fluffy white head.  Extremely powerful smell of banana bread. First taste of bananas and slight yeastiness, quickly turns to a crisp hoppy wheat.  A nice level of spiciness and boozy flavor through the entire tasting.  This is one of the best things Ive ever drank.

Heavy for a hefe but at nearly 10% that is unavoidable and doesnt really take away from overall experience. I like the aroma as its lacking in hardcore bananas and such. Not sure how old this bottle is but I barely get some hops in there.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 RE RATE 04/14     lowered slightly from 4.1.  still great brew......                          bottle recd courtesy of jckp64.  hazy light pour with big white head with med. lacing.  LOTS of aroma and taste with this one - not sure I can come close to identifying all the flavors/aromas in this one - complex hefe that is VERY good!!!!  bananas, and some spices really make this stand out - nice taste all the way on this one

Big thanks to BeerFMAndy for getting a box of New Glarus out to me. Served in a New Glarus taster glass.

Pours a fairly-cloudy bright yellow-golden with a short white head and a spot or two of lacing on the way down. The nose has quite a bit of sweetness combined with some banana, clove, and a touch of spice. The flavor is fairly boozy with some spice and residual sweetness. Too much malt sugar remaining here, IMO. Body is a bit thicker than Id like with some extra alcohol. I prefer NGs lower-abv German wheat offerings.

Average hefeweizen color, albeit slightly darker. Strong hefe aroma, cloves, bananas, wheat, wonder bread. The flavor is very sweet and has a great thick maltiness that is made smooth bye the flowery sweet yeast flavor. A lot going in here for such a clear light colored beer.

Right after I poured the beer, I got a waft into my nose that made my mouth start to water. The smells you get from this beer are ridiculous. Top that with its amazing taste and I would recommend anyone to try it.
Bottle with Pat. Pours a glowing orange, spotty lacing, small to med head. Aromas of bannanas, wit bier spice, cloves. Taste is circus peanut bannana marshmallow with some spice.

Bottle 33 cl, trade. Pours hazy orange amber with a great bubbly off white head leaving nice lace. Aroma is wheaty, yeasty, sweet, bready, spicy, has a bit smokey tones, bananas and fruits. Flavor is a bit boozy, otherwise as aroma, has good bitterness, pungent and very fruity. Lots of citric, wheat and yeast flavors as well. Finishes bitter pungent with nice yeastyness. Just great imho.

From a body poured a hazy orange body with little to no head. Aromas were mainly clove and herbal, but heavy with hints of earthiness and perhaps salt. As expected, clove is in the taste, but is unusually spicy while settling into a warm alcohol finish with bananas as malty backbone. Solid.

Thanks to Chipalsa for this one. The nose has a clove and citrus dominance with a touch of sour underneath everything. This one poured a nice hazy orange color with a white head. The flavors are again, banana, warm spices, some light citrus, and is a touch on the sweeter side. Some alcohol, too. Very drinkable for the generous abv.

Pours a hazy golden/Amber color with a tight fizzy white head. Has excellent lacing. Aroma is mostly citrus and Clove. Tastes of Banana, little bit of hops, citrus fruit, with some sort of funkiness. That must be the "Imperial" part of the beer. Sweet throughout with a little resiny aftertaste. Smells and tastes even more like bubblegum as it warms, crazy. Very good, very complex, very drinkable.

Bottle from a generous BA trader - thanks!  Pours a hazy, glowing yellow with a huge and chunky white head that leaves spotty chunks of lace down the sides of the glass.  Aroma is clean banana, clove, soft spice (nutmeg?), and a bone dry malt backbone.  Taste is even clove with some complimentary spices followed by banana, a dry and clean malt backbone, and some minor alcohol toward the finish.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Some of the New Glarus beers are hit and miss for my personal tastes but I am really blown away by this beer and how they pulled off such a big hefe that is so clean and balanced.  Damn impressive beer.

Tasted on 8/14/11 from a 12oz bottle purchased at Discount Liquor.  Pours cloudy, light yellow-orange with an average, smooth white head that slowly recedes to uneven lace and a thin collar.  The nose is more floral than the average weizen, with some lightly bitter hops, and the signature banana and cloves yeast.  The flavor is more dominated by the banana and cloves, with some lightly caramelized malt, and a hint of bitter floral hops.  The body is medium, but somewhat weighty with average carbonation and a long finish that represents the flavors well.

Bottle. It pours a very hazy yellow/orange color with a tall fluffy white head. The aroma is very nice with some lemon, orange, vanilla, clove and pepper. Very yeasty. The flavor is so much better than I expected. Sweet citrus fruit up front, mostly orange followed by a complex spiciness of clove, cinnamon, vanilla and pepper. Some more tropical fruit comes through before a wonderfully complex spicy aftertaste. The mouthfeel is beautiful. Not too sweet and very light bodied for how big it is. This was such a pleasant surprise. I wish I had more.

Bottle courtesy of adneilsen (thanks AAron) poured a cloudy gold with a lasting creamy white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, pepper, banana, light bubblegum and a hint of clove. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a warming finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, banana, pepper, light clove and light alcohol with a crisp warming lingering banana finish.
Bottle.  Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head.  Very lemony and peppery, very bubbly and light on the tongue.  Very good, one of the better of the style, I think.

Bottled 330ml
Hazy orange color, good creamy off-white head. Overriped banana and citrus in the nose. Full-bodied. Sticky, glueish flavor. Banana, clove, hops, Estery, alcoholic and fruity. This is not "German Hefeweizen", more like Weizenbock.

Bottled (thanks Papsoe!). Hazy yellow colour, small slight off-white head. Aroma is wheat, citrus, caramel and mild acidic wooden notes. Flavour is sweet malts, mild banana, wheat, citrus, toffee and mild alcohol as well. Balanced and quite good.

Bottle. Strong, wheat aroma with hints of banana and some salt. Hazy gold with a huge head that is long lasting and leaves a frothy, intricate lace even before the first sip. Higher alcohol evident immediately, and the hotness is a little overly distracting. Still, if you like German wheat beers, this is one on roids. Far better than most German wheats youll have but definitely not sublte.

I must say, I find it slightly ridiculous that this is listed as a Hefeweizen at 9.6%, but when they tried to session-ize it with Crackd Wheat, that one got listed as a Wheat Ale.... gracious me.

Pours a beautiful impenetrably hazy golden color with a huge fluffy white head and lots of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma up front is way too dish-soapy for me, lots of apple rind and brash citrus.,,, but as I let it sit in the glass this tends to mellow out a lot leaving a far more pleasant aroma of lemony citrus, sweet banana, & orange leaving apple behind (thankfully). Its a veritable fruit basket of a bouquet. 

The flavor is sweet, sweeter than I would like it too be, but what was I to expect from an Imperial Weizen? Its got a lot of fruit flavor plenty of citrus and the level of bitterness is nice. But I get a clash from the sweetness here that reminds me of  what I dont like about crystal heavy APAs and IPAs, the sweetness paired with the bitterness and the booziness all just sort of taste muddled up a bit. Im making this sound really bad, and I dont think it is "really bad" its just not exceptionally good. The spiciness is nice and I enjoy the hop flavor... it works well with the yeast driven fruitiness but again sweetness and booziness get in the way a bit. 


Bringing the gravity down on this to make Crackd Wheat was the best thing they could have done with this recipe, I waited for years to try this beer and I dont think its a case of my impossible expectations being let down as much as its just sort of not my kind of beer... which is not to say its a bad beer. I enjoyed it, I just didnt love it.

Hazy medium/medium light gold,still fairly transparnet.Creamy head,thick decending lacing.
Fantastic aroma of fresh belgian yeast  fruit and sweet spices vanilla not e of bannana floaral hops-very nice.
Taste is a thick rich  hoppy citrusy sweet with the orange spice lemony tart citrusy a bit grassy bitter finishGood breadyness. Some alcohol as it warms.Very nice to drink not boring at all.

(12oz bottle courtesy of Alpar).  Pours a cloudy yellow color with fluffy white head.  Active carbonation.  Aroma is citrus, clove, banana, bubblegum.  Taste is sweet with more bubblegum flavor and some citrus pith bitterness.  Full bodied with a bit of heat from the alcohol.  Dry, bitter  finish.

Pours an opaque pale honey color with a thick white head...excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma is hoppy...some citrus...a bit tart...some yeasty fruitiness.  Flavor has some sweet citrus, mild spicy notes, and some wheaty, earthy notes...very mild barnyard funk and tartness.  Mouthfeel is very lively and silky and the finish is dry, spicy, and slightly tart.

12 fl oz brown bottle from arminjewell! Pours out dark golden and cloudy. Giant white head with a rocky surface. Thick strands of lacing clinging to the glass. Sweet and spicy nose, big cloves, light tangy note, lemon, yeast, maybe a bit of vanilla. Taste has some sweetness up front, some honey, banana, then lemony hops come in. Finish has some strong hoppy notes, citrusy, leafy and a bit piney. Also some yeast. Aftertaste is long and is a mix of yeast and hops, there is a lingering fruitiness that is quite pleasant.  Alcohol is there but blends in nicely, no hotness. Does not drink like a 9%+ beer. Big bodied, full mouthfeel, mellow carbonation. Pretty unique, pushes Hefe into new territory.

ddfrazee with another crazy hookup! Brings me a mixed sixer and BLAMO, 6 unrated brews.  Amazing!! Pours a cloudy yellow/gold pour.  Aroma is loaded with bananas, cloves, spice cake.  Flavor is loaded with banana, toffee, brown sugar, light bitterness.  Fucking amazing. SHIT!

Pours cloudy gold with a medium head. Nose is immensely citrus, those Cascade hops really bright and shiny followed by wheat notes. Smooth, creamy, lush on the palate, medium to full bodied. Sweet, very sweet, but with enough body and a mild hoppy finish to prevent it from being cloying. Really nice overall.

Bottle.  Pour is deep, rich, cloudy golden with a medium white head. Looks great. Aroma is bubblegum hop, toasty wheat malt, light spice and a touch of lemon.  Flavor is also very rich with notes of bubblegum hop, what malt, earthy spice, an light lemon. Really good.

Extra from MarkWise, Another pleasant gem in a monster box. Light creamy films hover over the yellow/orange stained glass body. Smell is massively banana, Its really so banana that I dont even detect nearly as much clove as Id expect. Flavor is huge banana bready malts that is lightly seasoned by a green hop garnish. Thick flakey banana bread biscuit body pushes the beer forward through the strong feels from a seemingly higher abv. I really liked this, really makes me want to try dancing man wheat.
Another great NG beer, I tasted it on draught in WI and in a bottle at a tasting at CCB, great balance in the taste and Im still thinking they dont do bad beers!!

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 Picked up four pack in store in Kohler. This is very good. Bready banana-iness. Yeasty flavor and aroma.  Light golden color. Well done.  I would think that this might be a Weizenbock because of the strength. Serving: Bottle
Bottle.  Golden color, cloudy.  Aroma of banana and light spice.  Taste is chewy banana and clove bubblegum.  Nice.

Aroma: Bready yeast at first, then clove, then banana, then bubblegum/cotton candy, then... peanuts?  Its a circus in my nose!  Lots of phenols.  Even something that hits me vaguely as new car smell.

Appearance: Hazy golden yellow.  Slightly darker than a traditional heffeweisen, but hey, its an IMPERIAL weizen, so its to be expected.  Nice thick head that looks like it could be the next generation memory foam mattress.  Spotty lace forms islands of white around the sides of the glass.

Taste: Surprisingly balanced bitterness considering the 9.6%ABV.  The taste mirrors the aroma but with some alcoholic warmth...  now its a drunken circus.  Sweet, vanilla-cream once things settle down.  A malty sweetness sticks with you for a few minutes to remind you of the fun but without turning into that annoying friend who just doesnt know when to leave.

Palate: Full bodied and highly carbonated.  Long finish.

Overall: This is a great beer.  If you love wheat beers, but want one when its 30 below and youre tailgating at the Packers game, this one will keep you company.  Another hit out of this cult brewery from north of the Cheddar Curtain.

This one pours a nice cloudy, tinged gold in color with great turbidity. The aromas are moderately sweet, full of banana, clove, and it has a nice lemon zest aroma that is really interesting. The flavor is somewhat sweet and ultimately spicy. It is very heavy on banana, clove, spices, lemon, and oranges. I dont know if Ive had a hefe quite like this one before. Its very, very complex. The lemon and orange are something completely new to me in regards to a hefe. It finishes light and smooth. Youd have no idea that there is 9.6% abv. It is so, so smooth and very easy to drink. This is a deceiving drinker. Overall this is a very, very nice beer and a very interesting hefe. This one is a legitimate success. Well done NG.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with a smaller white head. Outstanding aroma of clove and yeast. Medium palate, but fairly heavy for the style. Nice carbonation, and the flavor explodes with clove, citrus, and cinnamon. This is extremely well done!

pours hazy blonde with a lasting thick white head and lots of lacing.  aroma is a unique blend of hops, peel and banana with an intriguing warmth and spiciness. the body is the heaviest ive seen in a hefeweizen.  taste is quite hoppy but the alpha acids yield after a moment to reveal the complex citrus and clove notes also present.  finish is bitter sweet. this is a lovely beer.

Thanks to GhostFace for this one in trade.  Pours a cloudy orange with a white head that recedes.  Nose is a sweet wheat beer that has been hopped: I get wheat, bread, berries, bubble gum, and lots of citrus like oranges- almost conflicting with each other but creating an enigmatic blend of flavors.  Taste is similarly conflicted: it wants to be Dancing Man or a similar sweet wheaty beer, but the hops are fighting with that request.  Definitely different and unique with a full body for a wheat beer and lingering hoppy berries in the finish.

Bottle. Cloudy golden body with orange highlights. Pillowy white head, mostly lasting. Lots of clove, cinnamon and yeast in the aroma. Hints of banana, bubblegum and toasted grain. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Some acidic, citrus tartness. Medium to full body, velvety texture and moderate carbonation. Overly sweet. The rest of the balance is nice. Much bitterer than a regular hefe, but it works, especially because of the sweetness. Clove overpowers the banana. Interesting beer and a nice sipper, but would rather drink a good hefe.
Yeast and cloves in the aroma and also in the aroma. The palate is great, smooth and slightly tingly. Brought to me from Wisconsin by uckelman. Bottle.

Nuzzling up to perfection. What an uber hop weizen a la American style. Absolutely slammed the Belgians here. Poured with a huge foamy, frothy, off white head and great lace. Aroma is banana, yeast, bubblegum, malt, hop, Flavor is largely like nose, plus yeast bitterness leaps out along with sweetness of the malts and propelled by the alcohol. Body is outstanding and ditto carbonation- couldnt be exceeded. Finish is like flavor and lingers with diminishing presence to a point where I cant find the point only that I want another point. The occurance of excellence.

bottle... medium honey gold with a big off white head, good retention but light lacing... muted nose that gives off a little banana with a touch of hops on  the back that break up the typical hefe sweetness, wish it was stronger but I like it... the taste doesnt come together well as it really separates the hefe on the front with a hoppy distracting finish, tough and confusing to drink
Pours cloudy orange with a nice white head. Aroma is wheat malts, bananas and clove. Flavor is banana, cinnamon, malts and yeast. Medium bodied and medium carbonation. Overall a pretty good beer.

Bottle pours cloudy light orange with persistent white head.  Aroma of citrus, banana and spices.  Taste orange, cinnamon, coriander, cloves, wheat.  Finish slight hops.  Fizzy thick palate with high acidity.  Alcohol well hidden.
Really well done beer.  Like a really good weizen but more of everything.

12 ounce bottle sent as an extra that poured a hazy orange color tha tlooked amazing.  I have had this for 3 month sitting, and I have been excited to try this one out.  Aromas of banana, clove and hops.  Flavors follow the aromas, with a subtle grapefruit flavor that was quite refreshing comapred to the normal orange flavor you get with weizens.  How is tihs over 9% abv?  It sure as heck doesnt taste like it.  If you have more, ill trade you, it is a real good brew.

bottle thanks to ncmussel.  poured a hazy yellow with an orange tint and a white head that laced the glass and lasted the life of the beer; which was short.  aroma was banana, lemon, wheat, grass, cream, and a slight cinnamon note.  flavor was cinnamon, wheat, lemon, grass, alcohol, and maybe a pinch of vanilla.  body was medium with a medium soft carbonation.  absolutely wonderful!!
New Glarus:  constantly proving that wheat beers arent always nasty!  And this is no exception.

Bottle (from Skyview - much thanks).   Clove, orange, banana, and wheat malt aroma.  Cloudy amber color with large white head.  Sweet peach, banana, wheat malt and moderately bitter clove/herbal hops flavor.  New Glarus does it again.

12oz bottle, hazy and a glowing golden in color. Beautiful head settleng down slowly and retaining well, nice lacing. Really nice aromas, citrus, yeast, wonderful clove, lemon and hops. Alot going on here, really complex with layer after layer of wakening my senses. Body is creamy and smooth, just the right amount of bitterness finishing slightly dry. The flavor is also amazing with wheat malts, pepper, fruity citrus and yeast. I;ve been wondering how this beer had ranked so high in its style for quite some time and now I can see it is well deserved in its ranking. Overall an unbelievable brew! Thanks Brandon!
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Very hazy orange-yellow, puffy white foam that takes a while to settle.  Aroma is noticeable alcohol thinness some cloves, some citrus, mostly oranges.  Taste is lots of alcohol, lemony burn, nicely dry, citrus, some spiciness.  It seems like a beer that needs some age despite the modest ABV, or maybe it is just the very strong esters playing tricks.  I can see where this was going, but it wasnt especially enjoyable to drink.

Bottle from badnewsbeers, the guy who copies all my ratings. Hazy medium orange body, thick puffy cream head. Grassy nose with clove, hints of banana, bubblegum, and sharp citrus (lemon). Sharp, sweet body with loads of clove and bubblegum, grassy, with bitter citrusy hops and a bitter hops-alcohol finish. Complex but a bit rough. Still very good.

Bottle pours hazy deep gold(almost orange) with an eggshell head. Aroma is huge with notes of banana, clove, wheat, and vanilla surrounded by fresh citrus hops and light floral notes. Flavor is equally impressive with additional notes of lemon and pineapple bubblegum. Overall body is moderate, creamy, and finishes with light to moderate bitterness as well as a touch of alcohol. Definately interesting and not your average hefe.

Having just returned from 4 monthsin Germany I thought I would give this one a shot. I guess it isnt a traditional beer but whatever.

First off I grab my Weihenstephaner glass and pour it. Then i realize  (or all of Germany). The head definitely is "prettier" than most German wheat beers. I tend to prefer the more rustic, creamy look of the German ones, of course this doesnt apply to all cases.the beer it self is a cloudy light gold. Perhaps a bit light for a weizenbock, but good looking nonetheless. 

The smell is the first thing noticeably different here. This is alcoholic and hoppy, not really what the typical German weizenbock is.

The flavor is similar. Too hoppy and orangey/bitter.

I understand this is a bit of an experiment as it is a completely new style of brew, but one of Dans weaker ones unfortunately. Hops + Weissbier is a hard thing to get right, Dan should try some Schneider for reference.

bottle, from a trade that Im not recalling or finding in my notes. consumed 5/27/11. Good aroma, sweet. Fruity, yeasty. Banana, pinneapple, caramel, clove. Golden orange color, good head, that faded quickly, decent lacing. Bitter sweet flavor. Full body, lite creamy mouthfeel, dry sweet finish. Interesting, not sure it works as an imperial, but I enjoyed it. Aroma probably best part, but just marginally over the flavor, always happy to have a New Glarus offering.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Traded bottle. This was another NG bottle conditioned beer that poured out with huge yeast clumps and flakes. I need to learn that lesson. Anyway, interesting concept but I think it was just too much for me. Good but just pushed the style too far past the breaking point.

Bottle from the New Glarus bottle shop. Pours murky gold, frothy white head that settles like meringue. Nose is as advertised; just imagine a revved-up weizen: lots of lemon, banana, clove, earthy spices. Just a bit of alcohol sharpness. Taste is quite lemony and breaded, but taking your time with a few sips yields a solid hop presence. Unique.

12 oz bottle. Pours a very nice glowing cloudy orange with a creamy off white head. Aroma is very well balanced between the clove, banana, wheat breadiness and citric hops, spicy and sweet and hoppy all in unison. Flavor starts sweet and clovey, very clovey before opening up to a fruit salad of banana, orange peel, a touch of lemon and finishing with a clear fresh citric hoppiness that lingers in the lightly bitter finish, along with a touch of alcohol. Medium creamy body and a softish carbonation. A really nice weizen, lots going on but fits perfectly and the abv is surprisingly well hidden.

bottle. pours cloudy orange with medium white head. aroma of grass, citrus, heavy coriander, cracked pepper, and some sweetness in the finish. flavor is a beautiful bouquet of pepper, spice and herbs, clove, orange rind, coriander, banana, and some bitter hops. the overall hop character was not expected, and was more than welcome after taking a sip. a fantastic beer

Pours a cloudy gold with a 3 finger, creamy eggshell head that has great retention and leaves nice thick rings of lacing. Aroma is full of bright citrusy goodness as soon as the bottle is cracked, lots of banana, some clove, bready yeast and light vanilla with just a touch of tropical fruit if you really sink your nose in there. Flavor is huge on sweet grainy wheat and bready yeast up front, then comes the sweet banana, hints of spicy clove and toast and then the flood of hugely citrus hops, lots of grapefruit and lemon taste in there, finishes solidly on citrusy hops and a touch of wheat. Might be a bit too much alcohol coming through as it warms a bit above fridge temp. Palate is pretty heavy bodied, creamy on entry, dry with a little alcohol slickness to the finish and a medium, sharp carbonation. Really tasty, dangerously easy to drink despite the high ABV and somewhat heavy feel. Perfect summer time sipper. I could definitely see this one going down hill, hops-wise pretty quickly, though I thing it would still be great as far as high abv wheat beers go.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2011 Bottle @ home, courtesy of arminjewell. Thanks Armin! Beautiful luminescent orange appearance with a white head. Yeast, cloves, some spiciness,  light booze, wheat, light floral notes. Bready, cloves, spicy, floral hoppy, big citrus fruity, light banana flavor. Clove and floral aftertaste.  A touch boozy and more hoppy than other weizenbier. A refreshingly interesting take on a style that doesnt see too much experimentation. I find	Dancing Man Wheat a little superior but what a nice brew!

Pour from a bottle. Murky golden orange color with a nice white fluffy top. Yummy aromas of banana , gum, and bready yeast. Nice smooth mouthfeel. Initial burst of some citrus hops followed by some earthy wheat, clove and herbs. Tasty finish and flavor retention! Very nice !

Refrigerated bottle compliments of cbfobes poured into a weizen glass.  Pours cloudy orange with two inch head that dies down to a quarter inch head pretty quickly.  Pretty good lacing, medium body, sticky texture, and aroma is primarily hops.  Taste is hops, some grapefruit, a little clove, a little alcohol, and finishes ong hop spice.  This is more like half american pale ale and half hefeweizen, it is pretty good.

Bottle, shared with GT2. Pour is a hazy white with good head/retention/lacing. Aroma is banana, clove, cinnamon, bubblegum, a bit of citrus. Flavor is more banana, bubblegum, a bit of soap, citrus, creamy of wheat. Palate is creamy, soft and quite boozy. Not bad but Id take crackd wheat to this any day.

355mL thanks to Ughsmash. The pour is a beautifully translucent, glowing yellow peach color with a towering buttermilk head. Very nice retention and spongy layers of lace. Nose is heavy yeast phenolic: massive bubblegum and sharp banana moving almost to artificial banana flavoring in the nose. Clearing exhibits classic hefeweizen notes albeit even more phenolic than Im used to. Taste is similarly massive bubblegum and fake banana finishing a bit soapy and tart. Strong alcohol permeates through as it warms. Hides the near 10% well though. Comes across as 7.5-8%. Probably the truest to life imperial hefeweizen there is, but that doesnt mean I have to love it.

A: The pour is a hazed golden amber color with a big off-white head on it.

S: Smells sweet with plenty of spice.  Lots of banana, cloves, and some nutmeg and cinnamon.  Light notes of citrus peel (oranges, for the most part) to go along with a lot of sweet malt and bread aromas.

T: Much the same in terms of the flavor.  Sweet bread, honey, and wheat malt flavors.  Banana and orange fruitiness with lots of spice notes.  The clove and nutmeg seem to be the most abundant.

M: Medium to full in body with a medium level of carbonation.

O: Good flavors and aromas, though a bit too big to drink a ton of.  Nice beer.

12 oz bottle.  ABV 9.6%? Shut up!  Seriously, you cant feel it.  However, you can smell and taste the orange and spices.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a big thick head and tons of lacing.  Medium mouthfeel with a nice bitter finish.  Excellent.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 Dull yellow/orange color, very active lots of frothy white head. Smells like bananas and orange citrus. Tastes great, hints of banana bread and clove, doughy ,little bit of a citrus hoppy bite. Very full thick body.  Sweet and bitter citrus hop notes. I love the stronger hop flavors than im used to in this style. If You like wheat beers and you like hoppy beers this ones for you. New Glarus makes another awesome beer for the unplugged series big surprise. I
bottle from ky.     notes of bold earthy doughy banana.  slightly rustic.   a bit of sweet old brown banana.  touch of toasted nuttiness. big body.  would prefer a nice clean 5 percent beer rather.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a large, billowy two finger head.  Aroma is what you would expect from a nice hefeweizen.  Banana, strong clove presence, some yeast.  What comes though in the flavor is totally unexpected.  A perfectly full bodied mouth feel accentuates huge orange citrus notes, cider like mulling spices (besides just cloves!), banana esters, some grassy hops, bready yeast, and  a tad of heat on the finish.  Creamy, aggressive hopped for the style, and a long, lingering finish.  Awesome!  At 9.6%, this is danger in a bottle.

Beautiful cloudy golden amber pour and a puffy white foamy head.  Huge banana aroma with a candied malt note to it.  Flavors are a big blast of German hefe, banana, clove, mild spice.  There this lovely candy gummy flavor bouncing around as well, Id think a nice kick off from whatever yeast theyve chosen.  Just enough of a hop note towards the end for a nice little lingering with all the other flavors.  Dank stuff right here...!!

12oz bottle from Steves Liquor and More in Madison, WI. Pours a very cloudy and hazy, golden-orange colored body with a big, two finger-width, dense, creamy and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is quite nice. Lots of citrusy hops mixed in with plenty of banana, clove, medium sweet wheat, bubble gum, and a light yeasty spice. A bit of an herbal quality to the hops with a hint of vanilla and some lemons and oranges. Flavor has lots going on, but seems a bit messy. Lots of banana and wheat up front with a nice lemon and orange citrus along with plenty of clove and some coriander. An herbal spiciness and bitterness quickly comes in along with some yeast spice. A light bready malt and some tropical fruits before this finishes dry and fairly spicy with a light, herbal bitterness and a somewhat chewy malt sweetness. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium, somewhat sticky and chewy body with a hint of alcohol warmth. Medium, creamy carbonation. Overall, a nice beer, but Im not really a huge fan of these bigger hefes. They remind me too much of homebrew experiments gone wrong. This one is enjoyable enough, however, because it is highly hopped and not overly spicy. A bit messy, but for a style I tend not to like too much, this was pretty solid.
Golden color with a foamy white head. Citrus, yeast and wheat with a tangy finish. Not bad but a tad overrated.

Purchased at Breeze Thru Liquors in Milwaukee, WI; enjoyed while watching Walk Hard before playing a show with my band in Chicago.  Very happy to try this one as these Unplugged beers are typically really good.  Appearance is a vibrant cloudy gold with a thin white head, a bit brighter than the typical German Hefe but without the rich white head.  Aroma is rather unique, Im getting banana and clove attributes with the addition of vanilla and citrus.  Taste is about the most explosive Hefe Ive ever tried.  The spiciness of the clove is apparent along with huge fruit juice notes, something like orange, banana, and (as Ive seen in other reviews) pears.  The finish is noticeably bitter, carbonation is pretty heavy and its a burper, but at the same time its an easy drinker.  The ABV is pretty high, and it does pack a punch.  This is a great one!

Bottle from Hans. Pours cloudy, deep golden, creamy and fluffy head. Notes of clove, apricot, banana, sweat yeast and esters on the nose. Rich, wheatty, bold hefeweizen. Masked alcohol with a long finish. Great big beer.

Bottle; pour is murky golden with a nice white head that retains well. Clove, spices, citrus, banana on the nose. Wezen bock? Whatever. Sweet breads, clove, banana, brown sugar , this brew is purely fantastic. and the abv? Nonexistent.

The bottle poured with a very large head and a color with some burnt orange tones with a yeast cloudiness. The smell was spectacular. Bananas, pears, and vanilla aromas were great. The taste was a little more citrusy than I expected, but it was very pleasing. If I had some kegs of this stuff I might bathe in it.

Appearance:  Pours a cloudy amber orange with a thick, creamy white head.

Aroma: Bubble gum, banana bread and vanilla.

Taste: Spicy clovy yeast, bubble gum and banana.

Mouthfeel: Thick with modest carbonation.

Overall: A bit too sugary for my liking.

I poured this one into my pilsner glass as I dont have an actual hefe glass.  But the tall shape of this one will fit just fine.  It pours a cloudy pale yellow color with a big fluffy white head.  The head sticks around for awhile and leaves nice lacing on the glass.

The nose is what you expect of a hefeweizen.  Lots of coriander, lemon and orange.  The yeasty hefe character.

The taste is a lot of the same except a nice citrusy hop character on the back side.  It adds a little extra character to the brew.  The 9.6% ABV is very well hidden and you could fool me if you told me that was the percentage on it.  Its smooth and crisp and really thirst quenching.
Pours a very cloudy yellow with almost no head. Strong flavors of banana, cloves, and sour yeast. A fairly bitter finish undercuts the experience somewhat.
Large tan head foggy yellow color. Large amounts of corridor on the nose, distinct yeast. Very sweet and smooth, strong.

12oz bottle. Orange hazy color, cloudy center with  a thin bubbly head. Aroma is yeasty with hints of orange peel. Flavor is a little spicy with hints of citrus. Sort  of heavy on the palate but nothing out of control.

Very potent aroma, lots of clove, faint banana, robust wheat malt character, bready yeast notes, some floral hops and citrus, lemons and oranges.  Pours a very cloudy golden-orange with a thick white head; great retention and good lacing.  Flavor is what is expected; amped up weissbier character with citrusy hop character.  Lots of wheat and grain flavors, clove, fruity lemon and orange, bread and yeast, some spicy and floral hops, great Bavarian weizen character all around.  Medium-full body, fairly chewy, medium-high carbonation.  Great weissbier, bursting with flavor, very well done.
Bottle. Pours burnt orange. Off white head. Nose/taste of orange and lemon peels, blood oranges, alcohol and wheat. Medium body. Good bit of alcohol in the finish.
Pours cloudy orange yellow with notes of clove that hazily make their way into a deep clove and nuanced banana bread flavors with the right amount of abv hiding in the background!

The search for that rare but somehow always not-quite-right thing that is the promise of a magnificent weizenbock ends here.   Schneider Aventinus is archetypal, but has these off-elements.   The Paulaner version is assertive, but not all flowers and rainbows.  Ive had interesting domestic attempts, but they all ultimately skew off in awkward flavor directions.  This new Imperial Weizen from New Glarus is the bomb.  It is  florid, complex, soaring.  Incredible, incredible mouthfeel and richness.  Hops  perfectly balance the elaborate, potent, but still fine fruitiness.  This is an incredible beer.   It leaves the rest of weizendom and even weizenbockdom in the dust - - so fresh, lush, and alive - -and it even puts the entire sordid aggregation of Belgian TRIPELdom to shame.  This is, like, what tripels SHOULD be.  Even the Piraats will be doffing their caps as they bow.   Boffo.

12 oz. bottle shared by John at The Royale- thanks, John! He went on a spontaneous trip up to Wisconsin on Monday and brought back some goodies. This one pours a clear gold color with a big, foamy white head that laces the glass. Aroma of banana, wheat, sweet malts, honey, apricot, tropical fruits, clove, and citrus. Flavor follows suit- banana, wheat, honey, sweet malts, sugar, tropical fruits, clove, and bread. Medium-bodied, with a sweet, chewy mouthfeel and modest carbonation. Really sweet and fruity. Very nice and easy to drink, with no trace of booziness.

12 oz. bottle from a 4-pack. I purchased this stuff from Hy Vee, or what ever its called. Fluffy head. It has a nice hazy orange body. This is looking perfect. Wow, the aroma is pungent, but it isnt astringent, or annoyingly pungent. What Im trying to say is, is that this smells like its European counterpart. Lots of clove here. Im not getting much in the way of cinnamon, or citrus, but this is still pungent. It has a wonderful yeast aroma. Wow, this has a nice chewy mouth-feel. The banana, clove, yeast, and a subtle cinnamon hit the taste buds. This is good stuff. Im quite pleased with this. The alcohol? Its not noticeable in any regard. This is great stuff here.

Hazy orange-yelow.  Nose full of citrus - orange, lemon - as well as banana, clove, spice.  Tangy, citrus flavor and a bit of an alcohol burn.  Moderate hop bitterness.  Medium, creamy mouthfeel.  Finishes slightly acidic.  Interesting.

Poured from 12oz bottle, pours a cloudy orange with a thick white head and sticky lacing through out the glass, aroma is full of clove mixed in with banana and touches of citrus and hops, the flavor has a nice kick of spices blended well with the clove and banana, pretty crisp and clean and the alcohol seems pretty well hidden.  Very well done, man Im glad I only live 30 minutes from this brewery!

Pours very hazy orange/yellow with nice lacing white head.  Aroma is perfect, notes of clove and cinnamon, some nice banana, tropical fruit, and citrus notes from the dry hopping, with slight notes of even some pine and grass.  Taste is a bit less potent, but has notes of banana, tropical fruit, yeast and some slight honey, pine, clove, and some sweet fruit finishes with a touch of grainy biscuit.  Very nice hefeweizen, balanced, not too sweet.  Oh the 9.6%...not apparent in any part of it.

12 oz bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  2011 Vintage.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a big white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is big, banana, clove.  Medium body on the palate with lively carbonation.  Flavor is bitter, clove, boozy, a little hoppy, with somewhat of a bitter hop finish.  This beer is pretty fresh, so I am going to let the rest sit in the cellar for a bit to see if the boozy flavor mellow out a bit.

smells big for a hefe, lots of clove.  cloudy straw yellow with white, almost creamy head.  definitely a hefe on steroids, tons of flavor- banana, clove, heavy wheat, doughy yeast, all in abundance with spices rounding out the mix. very sweet, some alchohol flavor but no burn.  i didnt notice the hops as much as the description sounds like i should.  if youre not normally a hefe fan you should still give this a try if they make it again, or even if you happen upon an old bottle.  wish i had one to see how it ages.

12 oz bottle received in a trade-poured into my snifter.

Still warm out even though it is September.

A-Body is a hazy, quite cloudy copper hue. Fogginess is dynamic and thick. Pours with a 1-2 finger foamy white head which eventually fades to a thin collar and leaves no lacing behind in the glass.

S- Alcohol is potent initially but some classic hefe weizen characteristics can be detected in the background- clove, white bread, a hint of banana-and maybe even a hint of anise.

T-Mild fruity esters upfront-a hint of apple, and white grape. A slight grainy tone is in the background as well as a hint of yeast. Some banana and spice come through for the finish with a moderate alcohol bite and big alcohol heat. The alcohol is most prominent in the end but some initial flavors linger.

M- Body is fairly light and dry and has high carbonation as well as some spritzy champagne like qualities. The yeasty smoothness keeps it from falling into the champagne category.

D- This is a decent brew, that with age, is reminding me more of a belgian tripel (american interpretation) than a german ale. Its quite boozy but complex enough to be enjoyable. Not sure what this was like fresh-right now it is decent, but not the best NG brew out there.

Serving type: bottle

12oz bottle from footbalm, thanks 
Appearance: Hazy yellow/orange with a nice sized white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Yeast, spices and floral 
Taste: Honey, spices, floral and wheat 
A nice, easy to drink Hefeweizen

ancient 4 pack found in the cooler at justmanns liquors in watertown WI.  appearance is gigantic nucleation and long strands of messy lacing.  big airy head and well hazed gold body.  aroma is immediately apricot and electric but pleasant and satisfying booze.  more fruits follow: bright tangerine so juicy you want to gnaw on a segment.  hefty yeast on deck but typical weizen esters are clobbered by american hops.  flavor is a continuation of the cornucopia of bursting flavors with more subdued booze here, impossible to believe this is nearly 10%!  strong wheaty note mid sample reminds you this is more then an ester gangbang.  hints of banana come and go through the nose and flavor but the hops are king, whilst they have been tampered with my yeast and distorted into something even greater then their original being.

12oz bottle courtesy of skyview. thanks, bob! pours a very hazy, golden orange with chunks of yeast and a fluffy, white head with great lacing. aroma is very nice with big notes of yeast, banana esters, orange and lemon citrus, and red apple skins with very subtle notes of clove and wheat. flavor was initially worrisome but really came into its own after settling down with loads of crisp, citrus hop notes, wheat, and sweet, chewy yeast backed by hints of honeysuckle, clove, and pear juice with light clove and white wine notes on the finish. palate is medium bodied and nicely carbonated with a crisp, dry, fruity finish. overall, at first outset i thought this one was way past its prime but it settled into a very tasty brew. would love to have tried this one fresh off the tap.

12oz bottle thanks to mikesgroove.
Appearance : Hazy amber with a very small head.

Aroma : Spicy and a bit floral with some fruity yeast. Notes of bananas. Slightly dusty and a little bit syrupy.

Taste : Some yeast and spices. Finish quite bitter and slightly alcoholic. A bit astringent on the finish.

Overall : Very weird beer. Something is bothering me on the finish. Interesting but a bit too much of everything. Not well defined. Fantôme could have brewed this. Disappointing.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2011 Re-rate with new 2011 vintage - Pours cloudy gold with a big white foamy head. The hops are really grassy and bitterly pungent on the nose, with tons of clove spiciness and sweet wheat in the background. A little apricot in there as well, along with some sharp heat. The taste is real doughy yeast, sweet tropical fruit, spice, honey. Finishes with the Cascade bite and a sharp booziness. Smooth out the heat and this is fantastic, but as it stands its just okay, and nowhere near what my memory was of this beer when it was released last. 

Original rating - 9/3/2010 - Bottle from JCapriotti...thanks Jason! - Golden pour with a white foamy head. Sweet, honey smell. Not as wheaty and lemony as it was fresh, more sweet and syrupy. A decent amount of heat on the taste, pretty bitter with some honey sweetness and a bit of fruitness. Well past its prime, but I guess thats the point.

A: snifter. opaque yellowish orange color. nice hick white head, light yellow tint. great retention level and nice web-like lacing.

S: huge citrus hop aroma with some citrus from the wheat. almost a brett aroma in there. great yeast aroma.

T: wow! great hoppy flavor, wonderful idea of dry-hopping a hefe. some clove as well. reminds me of brooklyn-schneider hopfen weisse. tons of citrus all over this, both hops and grain.

M: full-bodied brew, with a great palate. huge carbonation level.

D: very drinkable brew and very creative. I enjoyed it alot and would love to get more of it.

Hazy orange, smallish, creamy head. Aromas of banana and bubblegum, huge citrus hops. Flavor banana/clove up front, light bubblegum, finishes with huge citrus and light alochol. Medium body and carbonation. Sort of a pacific northwest weizen. Solid.

My Bottom Line:
Peaches, bananas and unripe pear skins cover this Imperial Weizens herbal, citrusy hops.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the cloudy amber.
-There is a lot going on here, but I must say I find the flavor profile a tad muddled.
-The fierce effervescence alleviates most of the bodys rotundity.
-A little more cohesion flavor-wise, and perhaps a cleaner yeast profile, and I would have loved this.

Bottle.

Appearance: Dirty orange body with a light mocha 2 finger crown. Loads of retention and lace caking everywhere!

Smell: Cloves and banana really dominate the nose. The underlying notes include cinnamon, cascade hops, and bavarian style yeast.

Taste: Bitter cascade hops, over ripe banana, and too much clove for my liking. Only a small tinge of alcohol which Im happy with. This one had taste potential but it faltered.

Mouthfeel: a touch syrupy with a "heavy side of medium" body. A bit cloying imho.

Drinkability: Doesnt taste good enough, have a nice enough mouthfeel, or a low enough abv to get a high score in this category.

This has probably been my least favorite of the Unplugged Series. One thing I should say is that I received the bottle as an extra in a trade about 5 weeks ago and have no idea how much age was put on it prior to getting it. The label says drink fresh so who knows if age has tainted my experience.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-03-2009

The bottle was surely faded, but still very good. A bit of oxidized honey notes peak around the fruity, spicy, wheat sweet body. Hops are no longer citrus, hints of earthy spiciness remain. Would have loved to try this in its prime, but it was still pretty darn good. Huge lofty head, over a rich gold body. Retention for days; just gorgeous to look at.

Beautiful rich gold with a thick rocky white head, hardly any carbonation.  Dry clove aroma, fair amount of oxidation.  Banana cream on the sip, and in body, some apricot candy.  Little sticky midpalate, not cloying.  Should have drank this when I got it.  Why do I wait so long?

Tried this a long time ago and forgot to rate it.  Actually had this at my bachelor party as the first beer.  Bad idea as a I blacked out not long into the night.  The beer pour copper-orange with frothy white head.  Aroma with tons of banana and clove notes and a little citrus hops.  Flavors were similar with nice amount of sweetness and a little alcohol burn.  Just as the description implies...a hefe on steriods.  Totally awesome and one of my favorites.  Hopefully they decide to make this again.

bottle-sampled back in 08-hazy dark orange with a smooth white head.  nice is of minty hops and banana esters-cool!  I bet this had more hops when it was a bit more fresh.  big body and banana flavors all over the place with a bit of piney hops under.  a big hefe-bold flavors and body.  Again, my notes are a but fuzzy here, but i remember this beer being a bit on the oxidized side and even so, it was very nice.  I would have loved ot try it more fresh, with the big cascades coming through more.  New Glarus always impresses me!

From the bottle, courtesy of a past Secret Santa, pours a hazy golden with a thick white foamy head.  Aroma is sweet and strong of citrus and alcohol.  Taste is equally strong, Citrus, alcohol, a bittering aftertaste, initially sweet but somewhat sour finish.  I could drink a couple of these, but then theyd get too heavy.

Pours a hazy golden color with a medium white head. Pleasant aroma of bananas, bread and cloves. Good flavor of bananas, bread and cloves with a mild alcohol presence. The body is medium with an oily texture and moderate carbonation. Nicely done.

Bottle: &nbsp Pale straw, fairly thick, large frothy white head, nice lacing. &nbsp Heavy wheat malt nose, almost this uber heavy cotton candy tinge but without all the sweetness. &nbsp Subtle medicinal aromas as well. &nbsp 

Hmmm.... &nbsp Wheaty on the tongue, a little bready, alcoholic, and as best as I can describe it I would say just like that heavy cotton candy without much sweetness. &nbsp Fiarly hefty on the body, thick mouthfeel. &nbsp Finishes a 

little musty, wheaty, almost a bit hoppy. &nbsp This is one hard one to nail down as its so different. &nbsp Its like heavy pixie stix without all the sweetness, if that makes sense. &nbsp Unique, not good, not bad, just seems like its 

too far removed from any one style, like an identity crisis or something. &nbsp Part Strong Ale, part Wheat Ale. &nbsp Thanks to John for the bottle!

Bottle shared at the DC Local tasting.  Pours a cloudy orange with a frothy, creamy white head.  Heavy carbonation.  Aroma thats wheaty, lemony, some light cold smoke.  Chalky in the mouth.  Flavor is earthy, classic hef, spices, wheat, sweet, a little tangy.  Finish is thick with a touch of alcohol burn.

12oz bottle, thanks CaptainCougar.  Cloudy light amber body with medium off-white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, straw/spicy, bubblegum.  Taste is moderately sweet, straw/spicy, some yeast, alcohol, light bubblegum.  Sticky medium body.

12oz bottle via trade thanks to badbeer on BA.  This is not badbeer, its goodbeer.  Pours cloudy yellow-orange with a large off-white head and good lacing.  Aroma is wheat, banana, spice, and citrus.  Flavor is very tasty, wheaty and a little yeasty with banana, clove, citrus, coriander, hops, and a nice mix of malts.  Palate is medium-full and slightly syrupy - hey, its 9.6% ABV though, you sort of expect that.  Overall very good, which I expect from New Glarus.

The "imperial" here is that the flavors were big and long-lasting.  But thats not to say I liked the flavors that were made big.  Some fruity banana, a bit of spice, and a strong hoppiness that hung on for a long time.  Hazy yellow with a big, loose and complex head, with a really lovely sparkle to the carbonation.  Fine but not to my liking.
Cloudy yellow. Long lasting white head. Banana and citrus in the mouth. A good quality beer.

The beer pours cloudy orange with a big off-white head, the aroma is citrusy with fruity and malty notes and a hint of strawberry.  The flavor is big fruity flavor with orange citrus dominating, sweet hints of coriander spice.  The palate is smooth with a heavy carbonation.  This is a pretty awesome wheat beer, I love how the citrus and spice meld, alcohol is barely noticeable.

Bottle of unknown year - Thanks buckybeer! - Pours out a murky orange with a small but frothy off white head...aroma is vanilla, fruit sugars, grapes, light booze and some rough grain...flavour is similar, sugar,yeasty  citrus, malt, tart on the end with some lingering spice and white pepper...great carbonation and well hidden ABV...

[Bottle] shared by STLWill. Pours a hazy gold with a large beige head. Aroma is of beets, candi sugar, and dusty wheat malt. Flavor is fairly one sided and very sweet. Lots of honey and orange. Lightly tart.

Not your typical hefe, but its still damn good. The hops used throw it off a bit for the style but its still tasty as hell. A little bit like the NG Crakd wheat but not quite as dry of a finish, and a thicker mouthfeel.
