A gift from kp.  12oz bottle, with red foil.  Pours a hazy orange.  White foamy head.  Aroma of  oxidized esters of alcohol.  It smells like a musty, aged, English-style Barley Wine.  It smells like it is gonna finish warm.    Bold and heavy bodied.  Rich malt complexity.  Medium sweetness.  Flavor of cracked wheat.  Lots of clove and citrus.  Very nice hop profile.  Very bold bitterness.  Hop flavors linger on the palate.  Finishes with a citrus peel bitterness and a touch of pepper and fruit. This is a very big beer.  Yummy too.     Rating 2009.

12oz bottle very generously brought out from the east coast by CaptainCougar.   Pretty opaque golden-orange color with a big frothy white head that threatened to over-flow my tulip glass but barely stayed in.   The aroma is a healthy dose of phenolics and banana esters (over-ripe banana) and a leafy, citrucy hop addition.   The flavor is much like the cracked wheat, but with more alcohol heat (duh) and a little more bitterness.   This is quite dry for how big it is, with wheaty malt flavors, spiciness, and medium fruitiness that is a little grapefruit and a little banana.   The body is rather light for the size of the beer, and has ample carbonation with a soft texture.   A pretty cool creation, but a little too much alcohol burn, that seems a bit overkill in conjunction with the bitterness.   I think that a little more sweetness would have helped.

12 oz bottle courtesy of likely Discount Liquors (Milwaukee, WI). I continue my journey through the famed NG Wheat Beers! Pours a glowing orangish gold, big white thick head that sticks around, coats and laces, with a good hazed body, but still glowing. Aromas are typical of the wheat style, pushing banana and clove off the bat, a touch of faint spice, but largely the typical fare (Which isnt a bad thing at all). Initial is a decent body, taking on slight initial bitterness and moving into the estery banana and clove body. A touch of warming alcohol, moderate hoppiness, a little more actually than a beer from this style would normally have leaving a bitter finish and a bit of chalkiness on the palate. This isnt too sweet at all, but the flavors are pretty good, as the cinnamon comes through more noticeably into the body more, which is very pleasant. Ive really become a fan of hoppy wheat beers, and this beer fully displays its hops without going over the edge. The wheat, esters, and flavors are still the focal point, as even delicate cinnamon can be picked out. The hops are wonderful, but dont detract from other elements of the brew. Very good. Cheers!

12oz bottle.  Thick tan-orange color with a perfect thick, lasting head.  The aroma is wheaty, but with that thick underlying malty alcohol, almost Bocky really.  There is some great hoppiness that almost takes you away from the wheat and thick malt taste.  Lots of subtleties, from a fruity tang to an almost candi sugar thickness/sweetness.  Excellent balance, with a perfect peppery spiced bitterness.  Wowsers.

Bottle 12fl.oz.Unclear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, caramel notes, moderate hoppy, pine, grapefruit, fenoel, light yeasy, banana. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20081129]
..wozers! what a wacky wonderful wheat! .. great pure flavours. . clean .. delicious! .. . one of the best hefeweizens ever!! .. . Please do not offer my god a peanut... .

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2011 Re-rate from the 2011 release.  I got to try a bottle of the last release but was anxious to try it again, thanks to zimmerbloke.  This pours a somewhat hazy orange color with a thick fluffy off-white head.  The aroma is an assortment of clove, cinnamon, yeast, citrus, wheat.  Smells good; there are whiffs of alcohol but not so much that it gets in the way of a lot of nice things going on.  The flavor is fairly sharp but not as alcoholic as expected (a good thing); a lot of bubblegum to go with clove, citrus hops, orange peel, wheat.  This isnt Dancing Man good but its far softer and delicate than I was expecting and overall quite enjoyable.  Based on my notes from a couple years ago, I wonder if the abv is a little lower in this release?  Perhaps its just better or more probable my tastes have changed.  Anyway, good beer.  Original Rating:   Bottle courtesy of pfoxyjohn. This is definitely a wheat beer on steroids. Pours a hazy golden color with a big fluffy off-white head. The aroma consists of melons, banana, orange, and an alcoholic yeasty scent. Flavors are sharp, tangy, and citrusy with lemon, orange peel, banana. There is a bit of an alcholic bite to this. Good beer. I enjoyed it on a nice warm Florida evening. Make sure you check the abv though... this isnt one of those slug in the sun kind of wheat beers.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange, creamy off-white head, that lingers through out, leaving nice lacing rings as it goes. Aroma is right away sweet with some fruit notes in, yeast in the background. Flavor is dominated by sweet malt, fruit notes, mainly banana and yeast. Had a slight metallic taste halfway through that didnt last. Not what I was expecting.
Power weiss!  There are reasons to double the strength and flavor of a hefeweizen, and all of them are good.  Great smoothness accompanies the traditional banana and clove flavor.

Went into this one thinking it would be a standard hefe and came out initially disappointed but then pleasantly surprised.  Hazy orange amber with a medium wispy off white head that hangs out and leaves streaks of lace as it turns back into beer.  Aroma of yeast, orange, fruit peel, spice, bread and alcohol.  Taste of alcohol, fruit, sweet malt, clove, cinnamon with a yeasty backbone.  Warming on the back end.  Id give the nod to dancing man, but this one is very good at what it does.

12oz bottle.  Copper in color with a small white head.  Yeasty aroma that is also sweet and malty with some hop.  Super yeasty flavor with a bit of pepper, malt and a touch of hop in the finish.  Not my style, but a decent brew.
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2010 Pours with a large foamy head, pretty hazy, with definite traces of citrus in the aroma. A great brew!

Trade with noncaloric. Cloudy gold. Moderate head. Good lacing. Tasty banana chip and clove scent. Big banana flavour with pepper. Chalky body. Big hops are almost lost in the front and middle but do make a citrus finish.

Poured from the bottle a hazy orange-gold with a significant rocky white head.  Lovely cinnamon and clove aromas set off the bright citrus that dominates.  Like sidling up to Carmen Mirandas headgear and taking a long, decadent whiff.  Flavor is grassy and yeasty, and accented by spiciness and lemon zest.  The finish is dry and somewhat hot, but not overly boozy.  Delicious.  NG once again proves itself the master of all things wheat.

Pours murky gold with an orangy hue. A one inch head of white fluff settled down to a full skim-coat on the surface. Smeared lacing with errant dots remained for the duration.

Aromatics lead off with a blast of bannana skins, lemon zest, orange rinds, and doughy yeast. Clovey phenols, quanine, grapefruit pith, and vanilla bubble gum follow through.

Medium bodied, with a crisp, creamy and lush mouthfeel. Expansive carbonation adds a nice liveliness.

Tart wheat, lemon pulp, light malt, and juniper berries start the palate. Bitter orange pith, spruce bark, cut grass, and grapefruit seeds step forward.

Finishes with a firm and quite drying bitterness, a lingering citric twang, mild alcohol, and an earthy fade.

Wowza, quite a bit going on here, especially after the brew warms up. Pretty well hopped up too. Highly drinkable but far from boring.

Big ups to BA goethean for opportunity.

Bottle thanks to goldtwins. Pours a bright and cloudy orange color with a big white head and lots of lacing. A spicy aroma, some alcohol, some yeast and fruit. The flavor is very nice; sweet fruit, apricots, yeast, citrus hops, sweet and spicy, and very full flavored. One hell of a hefe! Lemons and a spicy zest in the finish. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2009 12 oz, thanks General Gao. Humongous, enduring head on this nearly opaque orange-amber beer. Sweet aroma of fruit salad mix: mango, peach, pineapple, orange, banana and lemon. Flavor is a similar mix, with more notes of lemon than the aroma indicates, plus some caramel and resiny hop. Creamy frosting is left all over the glass. Light-medium body is silky smooth and dryish on the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2013 12 fl oz, courtesy of Papsoe/SoLan. Pours hazy orange with a diminished white head. Dry wheaty and malty aroma. Sweet malty and slight caramelish to a mild wheaty base flavour. Mild acidic and light fruity. On the dark side of malt/wheat flavours. Smooth and mellow yeasty finish with a lasting malt impression into the far finish.

Smooth fruity, mellow and light citrusy. Bitter and fruity, mellow hoppy. Smooth fruity, lingering hoppy.

Golden yellow with a creamy white head that leaves a spotty lacing around the glass and retains itself well. Smell is hoppy with plenty of fresh oranges in there. The aroma also holds some spices and a little cinnamon. Taste is of oranges, clove, lemon, and a little grapefruit. Medium body and carbonation; finish has a little alcohol bite to it. Pretty drinkable beer, though I don*t know that I*d have more than two in an evening, if I were so inclined.

This is the last of the bottles I purchased in August. Served in a chimay chalice right from the 38° cellar. Fruity, citrus and spice aroma along with candi sugar and some toasty malt. Orange colored and hazy. Taste is sweet malt, lots of fruitiness, lots of citrus, and lots of spiciness. Finish is malty with lots of fruitiness. I enjoyed this beer, it was almost more like a Belgian Triple than a German Hefe.
Bottle. Weak spicy aroma. Hazy dark golden colour. Small white head. The flavour starts off with some coriander, turns nicely sweet and then rather peppery. Not as fat or wheaty/bananay as expected.
Very good brew.  Will have to write my full description at a later time apparently.
Bottle 35,5 cl. Courtesy of SoLan. Hazy golden with an off-white head. Aroma of yeast and some phenols. Medium body, yeast, fruit and phenols. Rather bitter finish. Disappointing. 291108

The Trappists monks can say goodbye, except for the fact that this is a limited offering from New Glarus (anything labeled as unplugged is limited from New Glarus). I am most impressed by beers that have a high alcohol content and yet have a good taste - this is one of them - maybe the best. I shall forego the details on smell, initial taste, palette and after-taste on this one, because there is really nothing else that I have had that compares to this one.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a lazing orangey head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of wheat and fruits. The flavor is sweet malty with very strong notes of fruit - especially peaches, leading to a dry and lightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2009 3/18/2008:  New Glarus Unplugged Imperial Weizen has a thick, frothy, creamy, off-white head and a cloudy orange color. I can really smell what seems to be Cascade hops in the aroma with lots of clove, some banana, and a tinge of alcohol. The flavor is fruity and spicy (Belgian-like) with clove and lots of hops (Cascade?).  There is a mild to moderate level of bitterness that continues to build with each taste. The palate is smooth and creamy which goes with the full body, but seems to heavy for what is a Weizen beer at heart. Overall the flavors seem to be in conflict and the beer is just different.  It isnt nearly as good as the New Glarus Dancing Man Wheat.12 fl. oz. bottle from buckybeer shared with Rob.  Thanks Mark!  Rating #248 for this beer.
UPDATE on Unknown Date:   New Glarus Imperial Weizen has an aroma of banana and clove and is very spicy.  Its appearance is cloudy, deep gold, and has a lage, foarmy, lasting ivory-colored head that collapses to leave a puffy crown.  There is a massive level of carbonation but this doesnt seem to affect the full body as it is still creamy and mellow on the palate and coats the mouth.  The flavor is very spicy and presents clove and banana.  It finishes dry and spicy with some herbal hoppiness.  Again, this beer is quite hoppy and that really comes through in the finish.  Overall this beer is big and bold, generously hopped, and very herbal to the point of being minty!  Its definitely adventurous, but I havent quite come around to really liking this new style of "Imperial Wheat" beers which includes this one as well as other such as the Brooklyner-Schneider Hopfen-Weisse.  Maybe it will just take some time and a more open mind for me to come around...12 fl. oz. bottle from buckybeer.  Thanks again Mark!

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2009 Bottle shared by Crosling.  Poured a lightly hazy, bright orange color with a moderate off-white head that faded to a thick, soapy layer and left some thick sheets of lacing.  Sweet citrus aroma (tangerine and apricot) with some light spice and a bit of clove and banana paired with a nice wheatiness and a hint of floral hops.   Smooth, lightly bitter entry with some undertones of wheat and moderate citrus (orange, light lemon) and a soft clove spiciness that finishes with a moderate floral hoppiness with soft citrus undertones and some wheat.  Moderate carbonation, smooth on the palate.  Definitely a great beer.  Wow.

Sunset orange color with an initially large head that settles into a top coating film.  Bold nose hints of banana, clove, spice and caramel, very enticing and memorable.  Flavor is very nicely balanced, but doesn’t quite have the softness and delicate notes I’d like.  Very clove-like with the illusion of cinnamon spicing.  Nice finish.  Very nice ale.

I was expecting something like a weizen bock but that’s not really what this is. This is simply a banana-clove type hefe on steroids. TONS of banana bread in this one. You feel the alcohol more than you taste it. Thick like a meal. Good. Yum.

This is simply one AMAZING brew.  I have purchased as many bottles of this as i could find while it was still being brewed.  Unlike any beer i’ve tasted.  The complexity of flavors, the impressive head, the utterly unique aroma and silky, creamy feel in the mouth is unmatched.  This is a bold and amazing creation from New Glarus and i hope to see this brewed again in the future.  This is perhaps their best so far.
Bottle. Aroma of bread, orange peel and spice. Tastes of bread, banana, vanilla and finishes with a clove spicyness. I really enjoyed this one.

Bottle thanks to BMan1113VR via captaincougar. Pours a cloudy golden color with a massive head that I can only describe as "foam, if foam were a popcorn ball." Nose: Lemon, grass, clove, vanilla extract. Taste: subdued hops IMO, booze, banana pudding, orange and other such citrus. Mouthfeel: Silky yet creamy. Not as crisp as most hefes but his beer is pretty dang delicious.

Bottle thanks to captaincougar. Didn’t realize the alcohol. Interesting brew. Pours with a large foamy, off-white head and a hazy golden body with very good lacing. Aroma of bananas, alcohol and a lot of citrus hops. Smells like it already has a lemon slice dropped in it. Also some banana and clove deep in the background. Taste is bananas, lemon, orange, clove and vanilla with citrus hops dominating all other flavors. Creamy mouthfeel with light bubbles. Alcohol comes through quite a bit. Really follows the mantra of this experimental series.

Bottle thanks to valpoaj. Thanks! Pours cloudy golden with fluffy white head. Aroma is pure citrus. Flavor is sweet - but ends on a dry note and is fruity with some clove in there. Only an idiot would add a lemon to this stuff. New Glarus makes me want to explore German beers more.

Pour is hazed orangey golden with a thin sticky off white head...smell is immediately strongly citricly hoppy with some vanilla and banana and clove as it warms...taste is sweet at first, turning nicely spiced with clove and cinnamon for sure...then a light grapefruit bitterness in the finish....this is the only hefe that I think I might actually put a lemon in...I wonder what that’d be like...
Thanks to bitbucket tasting. Dark blonde. Really fantastic mix of yeast, fruitiness, sweetness and pretty big citrus hops. Fantastic stuff.

Pours liquid gold...just as thick and radiant.  Nose is semi-sweet; banana, citrus, clove, wheat, and yeast.  Flavor is bold...and dominated by clove, citrus, and banana.  The 9.6% ABV is truly invisible.  Not my favorite style but I can appreciate the brew.  New Glarus...great brewery!!!  hillfiiiiire, ketchepillar, & crowderm...THANKS AGAIN!!!

The beer pours a thick white head with a nice ring that coast the sides of the glass. It has a cloudy orange yellow color. The nose is of sweet light fruits and citrus hops. The initial flavor is nice and bitter with hops just popping in your mouth. Overall it like how is nicely carbonated and contains the right amount of hops and malt.

(12oz bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden orange body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of florals, banana, clove, lemon, and pepper.  Flavor of banana, wheat, cherry, clove, grass, some tangerine, and other herbs.

12oz Bottle. Noses very strongly in a piquant banana syrup and general fruit mish-mash. Phenolic for sure, but at a different level. Very sweet, perfumy and fruity. Inviting. Pours a heavily clouded golden-orange, with a tall finger of sparse, soapy opalescent khaki. Flavor is interesting. It’s like a hybrid barelywine-hefeweizen. I still get a lot of those delicious spicy clove flavors, but then much of the high octane ester production from the gravity. Interesting. Complex and rich, yet not heavy. Lots of carbonation and the spritzy fresh Hefe character gives this example lots of depth. Hops come in and just add to the show. Their parching dry leaf and herbal character add to the freshness. You know what this beer is? This beer is how Batch 8000 should have been brewed. This what that beer SHOULD taste like. The bristling rich edge of hops adds a nice quality to the beer. It’s not sweet, it’s got great flavors and complexity, while maintaining drinkability in the face of gravity. I’m impressed. Nice show, Dan Carey. A prickling of alcohol brings up the back, before a long glide into tart phenolic residuals and grassy fruits. Delicious! Thanks Nathan!
Bottle at Sunes (Thanks). Cloudy golden - white head. Pineapples, dryness, banana, wheat, yeasty, high hoppy. A bit boring.... still just a german hefeweizen.

A HUGE hefe!!!  The first hefe I had that packs a punch.  An onslaught of wheat and hops.  It comes out in the aroma and flavor.  This is just in your face with flavor and complexities.  Another outstanding effort by New Glarus.

Interesting hybrid: a bit of citrus (lime) and sweaty, musty yeasts. Notes of clove and huge amounts of banana with spices like pepper, clove, cinnamon. Somewhat funky hospital smells which tend to turn me off, although this is pretty good, because I can imagine the scent as perfumed, lacy panties. Sorry, it’s my best point of comparison here. New Glarus, you’ve done it again.
Pours attractive apricot with two finger thick off white head. The nose and flavor are sweet with honey, apricot and sugars. The mouthfeel is coating, on the verge of cloying.
honey gold pour nice big frothy head big banana and clove aroma mildly citrus very tasty i get a bit of waterchestnut

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2008 Bottle, weizen glass.  Big bouquet of carbonic yeastiness, pleasantly musty, shot through with cardamom and prunes. Pours a cloudy apricot-orange.  Huge frothy white head supports itself mushrooming above the glass, great retention and lacing.  Wispy curtains of sediment raining down through the beer.  Presents as a tropical fruit juice cocktail, with a hoppy edge to balance the malty sweetness, pineapple, orange, a hint of banana.  Initially, cardamom, maybe some cinnamon in the spice department, before the beer turns hot.  The alcohol burn is definitely here, but its well-complemented by cloves and peppery prickliness, and here that prune element in the nose comes into its prime, like a good plum brandy.  As the fruit fades, the hops take the stage again, more floral than grassy, warm lingering on the tongue, as the beer turns dry in its final aftertaste, which is quite pleasant (or maybe thats just me happily buzzed halfway through the glass) and seems to last forever.  Wow.

I like the style, thank you Bakerslp for the trade. clove, cinnamon and citrus are claimed and in the mix, though I do not think they contributed to my liking it, but they did to the aroma.  Very drinkable,if only I had a bomber to share, above average mouthfeel.  Dark colour and good head.

Bottle from monger.  Hazy orange in color. Big frosty head, that sticks around. Aroma of citrus hops and banana. Taste is an upfront bitterness followed by a nice banana/yeasty taste. Only to be followed by aftertaste of bitter hops Very enjoyable. Low carbonation and a light texture. Easy to drink. Great brew. Thanks James!

12 oz. into Alesmith pint glass; purchased at Discount, Milwaukee.  Pours with a large off-white head that looks full of protein, very firm on top and not really dissipating at all; opaque orange beer looks unfiltered.  Very spritzy and spicy aroma, lots of pepper, coriander, cardamom, very faint banana; smells light and refreshing.  Medium to full body goes down smooth, hits first with spices, mostly with a smooth and slightly sweet malt character, then the finish gives the characteristic wheat aspects in the fruit and yeast.  Late in the finish, this dries out big time, wonderfully, and is lightly peppery on the tongue.  Lasts forever.  Light and refreshing despite 9.6%, this is an accomplishment of a beer, even if it doesnt give any particular "wow" moment.  An ode to craftsmanship.

12oz bottle thanks to Santa 2008.  Hazy orange  caramel colored pour with a frothy white head.  While colder, this smells just like banana bread.  Nice and spicy.  Enjoyable flavor.  There is noticeable alcohol, banana bread and plumb/pear brandy.  Its a bit overly sweet but not cloying.  There is also some obvious wheat but laced with a mineral like flavor.  Hops are secondary and spicy.  Full round body that is wet at first but dryish at the finish.  Solid.

Bottle courtesy of xmarcnolanx (thanks Marc!).  Pours a cloudy orange with a thick, foamy white head.  Aroma is quite spicy: clove and pepper.  Also slight citrus and vegetable.  Flavor is rather sweet (brown sugar) and slightly vegetal (meaty stew!) with a citrusy hops and passion fruity finish.  Very interesting concoction!  Not really like any other hefe I’ve had, but I guess the label says to ignore that.  Delish!

Bottle. Aroma of lots of spices, lots of citrus, strawberry, mango, and with a downright lively feel. Flavor nice and hoppy with all that mango turning to bitter mango, some grapefruit, leading to an interesting and longlasting finish of crazy evolving...I dunno, stuff, sorry, I fail. Also retains all the wheat and more citrusy and spicy notes associated with the style at its roots. Fascinating and awesome beer.

Unfiltered honey brown with an off white soapy head that just won’t quit.  Never seen thicker lacing.  A delicious aroma of yeast and clove.  Very fruity.  Hops mate very well with the wheat and yeast to make a truly unique beer, and a good one at that.  Grapefruit, clove, orange, yeast, pine and some caramel.  This is a 12 ounce definition of craft beer.  An American Pale Weizen?  Wow!

Pours amber bronze with a cloudy off-white head.  The aroma has banana esters, some oxidation and piny / floral hops.  The hops keep the esters in check and make the aroma very enjoyable.  Medium / thick body with sharp carbonation that doesn’t take over because the body is so hearty.  The flavor starts with esters and spice along with some of the hops and a touch of syrupy sugar.  The finish brings out earthy / piny hops with a sweet resiny taste and feel.  A very nice version of a hefe.

A big thank you to my cousin for a bottle of this much anticipated brew!  It is a dark, rusty, unfiltered pour with a handsome crown and lacing.  The label is simple and unpretentious.  The aroma is astonishingly good - richly floral and piquant, with a little alcohol rising up from the wildflowers.  The taste is the first of its kind I have experienced - a hopped up hefe, from what I can tell.  (The label and Ratebeer describe what went into the brew.)  It seems like a wheat base with some fairly sharp hops layered on - also orange, a sweet dessert-like flavor, and some acidity.  There is a kick from the 9.6% ABV too.  This is very complex, but it is not entirely successful because the flavor requires all your attention.  Despite the quality of the ingredients, this beer demonstrates why wheat beers usually are not loaded up with hops.  The Cascade hops and hefe flavors do clash a little -  but this is still worth trying.

Pours a bright, cloudy orange colour with a sticky, creamy white head. Very large- well carbonated brew, but not overdone. Lacing is scattered and sticky leaving behind clumpy resinous rings on the glass. Aroma is tropical- bananna, mangoe, figs and hint of cloves. Taste is sweet, plenty more fruit- pineapple oranges and soft lemon zest in the finish. Touch of yeast is noticeable initially. Mouthfeel is creamy and spritzy.

Poured this out of a 12oz. bottle into my Saint Arnold’s glass. Tasted on 4/28/08
This beer looks pretty typical for a hefeweizen. It pours a nice hazy orange and has a very nice off white head that lasts for quite a while. The smell is pretty expected except for that amazing citrusy hop coming through past the banana and clove. Wow the taste of this is something else. It hits with banana and clove flavors and then the most amazing hop bitterness I’ve ever had in a wheat beer. This is one hell of a beer. Highly recommended.

Rating #375. From the bottle, purchased at Rileys in Madison. My first reaction to this was that it was Dancing Man on steriods, which prompted me to pull a bottle of Dancing Man from the fridge and taste the two side by side. The flavor profile between the two is remarkably similar, with this having more body and greater viscosity than DM. Notes of banana and clove are prominent on both the nose and on the palate, followed by hay, grass, and wheat berries. The finish is where the citrus and hops kick in, which is where this shows its difference from DM most profoundly. My overall reactions were that I liked this, but I find DM to be the more pleasurable experience, particularly given this style doesnt lend itself as well to the "imperial" brewing methods. And I would say that in terms of the more extreme weizens, I like Capitals take on the style better.

[1570-20080803] 12floz bottle. Boozy matchstick head chemical aroma. Hazy, medium orange body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head and nice lattice lacing. Sweet heavy citrus malt flavour is bitter initially. Medium-full body. Nicely balanced and quite interesting.

Sweet lemon, honey and some banana aromas.  Malt.  Rich and thick foamy head of long duration.  Color is orangish yellow and semi transparent. Rich orange and citrus flavors, grapefruit juice provides a bitter finish over a honeylike initial flavors.  Medium rich palate with a light alcoholic presence in the finish.  Good and strong.

Bottle, courtesy ??? at the recent tasting. Pours clear orange with a thin white head. Banana orange spice aroma. Full body and light carbonation. Sweet banana-laden taste with a bit of cloves and citrus on the side. It wants to finish with a wheaty sourness, but the banana is just too much. This is the beer I was looking for, as I suffered through the imperial weizens from other brewers.

Thanks to my secret santa for giving me the chance to try this!  Poured a cloudy orange with a nice white head.  Aroma was orange rind, spice, yeast and wheat.  Taste had some orange marmalade character, coriander, bitter orange peel, yeast, spice, and a nice full finish.  Nice and thick, and pretty rich.  This would make a nice christmas beer.
Bottle: Pours a hazy gold with a white head. Aroma, bananas, spices, floral notes, yeast and cloves. Flavor, spices, yeasty notes, floral, cloves, banana, bubblegum. Pretty good.

2008-08-03. Lightly hazy orangy body, decent head. (3+) Sweetish aroma, yeast and esters, bit alcoholic at times. (7+) Flavour is similar, sweet esters are a touch muddled but pleasantly so. Very light bitterness in the end balances the sweet core. Light wheat touches. Smooth medium to full bodied palate. Simple but lovely. Bottle via trade with Cheeseman.

bottle by way of iowaherkeye and the mystery swap. pours a hazy orange/golden brown with a gigantic foamy almond colored head. lots of drippy lacing is left behind. the aroma is strange... banana mixed with citrus, grass, wood and pickling spice (dry bay leaf, coriander, clove, cardamon and nutmeg). rather odd flavor as well... almost sour fruit, orange, lime pith, dusty grain, a hint of the abv% and a touch dry and bitter from the hops. spicy finish lingers into the aftertaste where it is met with banana and wheat. alcohol is definitely felt in the belly. medium to full bodied. the mouth feel is prickly at first but soon becomes creamy from the abundance of carbonation. interesting. thanks joey!

Pours a very deep golden color...mostly opaque.  Obscene billowing head which settles nicely with some good levels of lacing.  Aroma is pretty heavy on banana and clove...some alcohol hints and dark fruit as well...nice, but a bit over-the-top.  Flavor is also heavy on the banana and clove...some bubble gum, yeast, dark fruit, and a very high level of alcohol.  Drinkability is very low if you compare it to your ’typical’ German Hefe, but it is not a slow quaffer by any means.  As odd as this sounds to say about a beer from Dan Carey, this one was just too hot for me right now...the alcohol is just too much for this drink.  That being said, it gets good marks for expanding on a style without completely bastardizing it...not my fav, but a very handsome effort

A vigorous pour easily produces a five-finger thick, tan colored head in my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip glass.  The head is thick and creamy with quite a bit of structure and staying power and it also leaves lots of lacing on the sides of the glass.  The beer is a murky, pale amber color that shows a deeply hazed, reddish-orange tinged hue when held up to the light.  The aroma most noticeably smells of clove, but there is also more phenolics that lean towards, but don’t quite get to, aromas of plastic.  Fruit aromatics also play a role here; hints of typical banana, a slight, weird tropical fruit note and some musky melon notes.  there is almost a weird tartness this beer and there is a fairly big grain character that leans towards dusty crushed grain and cracker-like malt.  There is a certain spiciness here as well that I can’t quite place; somewhat like pepper, or grains of paradise, maybe a hint of horseradish, I really can’t quite grasp it.  An interesting nose, the higher original gravity seems to have produced a lot more esters and phenolics than one gets in a typical gravity Weizen-yeast ferment.  I am not quite sure it all works though, but it is interesting enough to not be objectionable.

As I take my first sip I also breath in the aroma, at which point it gets a bit hot with volatile esters and higher alcohols.  The flavor tastes of lightly sweet, dusty / chewy grain, with a backdrop of softer clove and other phenolic notes of plastic being lightly noticed.  Quite spicy, especially through to the finish where the piquancy is magnified a bit by a wheat tartness;  peppery notes in combination with the carbonation, sour ginger flavors, hot higher alcohols, .  Some sour melon notes and some not quite ripe pear flavors add a touch of fruitiness to this beer.  The body as a light fullness to it that is about right for a chewy Hefeweizen, but is down right dangerous for a beer of almost 10% abv; though the alcohol gets quite hot, so it ultimately is not hidden very well.

Clearly a derivative of a German Weizen and not nearly as funky as my description may lead one to believe; many of these flavors and aromas are noted particularly because they don’t usually play a role in the typical German Weizen profile.  An interesting beer, even if it doesn’t quite work, and it doesn’t seem to have that stripped out, filtered to death character that is typical of many New Glarus beers (not to say this isn’t filtered, it may be, but it better survived the process than some of their other beers).
bottle, golden color, very fruity alcohol nose, flavors are banana, spicy dentene gum and finishes with clove and lemons

from 12 oz bottle.  pours a relatively clear gold.  nose is dominated by grapefruit up front.  amazingly smooth with slight lacing, crisp up front and as it finishes.  citrus like orange as it warms and the wheat comes out more to balance it.  amazing, amazing beer

Bottle from Ross, president of Nambla. Pours a nice murkey orange amber with a white head and sticky lacing. Very nice banana clove esters, with some sugary wheat malt in the background. Medium to light bodied with a nice earthy texture. Nice pale wheat backbone, complimented by flavors of banana, clove, and spice. There is just the right amount of sweetness. Alcohol is apparent on the finish, with yet more clove and some yeast. It even has some hints of Belgian Tripel toward the end. This is well crafted beer. However, it’s not as refreshing as a well done Bavarian Hefe.
Pours a hazy golden color with a white head.  Aroma is wheat, toasty, apple, malt, and some alcohol.  Flavor is wheat, apple, clove, banana, and a peppery hop finish.

(12 oz. Bottle courtesy of Headbanger).  Aroma is a bold White scent with toasted wheat and coriander standing out.  Color is a very hazy gold with good carbonation and a thick tight head.  Taste is spicy and sweet. Starting with a medium body it goes down crisp with a sweet feel.  Finish comes in spicy with a nice coriander flavor, a slight roasted taste and a hint of banana, then a light bitterness.  After taste is a little more bitterness and only a faint hint of alcohol.  This is an amazing brew that hides the alcohol well.
Orange color with a light white head.  Smell is banana, clove, florals, and alchol.  Nice fruity smell.  Taste is alcohol, bananas, clove, and wheat.  Good beer.

Bottle:  Courtesy of alexsdad06, thanks Brad.  Murky orange pour with a ginormous white, frothy head.  Good amounts of lacing noted.  Immediately upon pouring I can tell that this is a special brew, unlike anything I’ve had before.  Spiced citrus wheat notes smack me across the face and I receive a swift roundhouse of hops after my lip is already bloodied.  Big wheat malt taste consisting of citrus, spice and a boat-load of hops that would whup on the Crazy-88’s.  Wonderful brew!

12 oz poured golden color with a small fluffy head.  Very yeasty aroma and flavor.  Breadlike too.  Some clove in the nose and very little in the flavor.  Not as much hops bitterness as I would have expected.  It did not taste like 9.6%, but by the end you could tell.  Nice hefe interpretation.
One of those rare GOOD American hefes. So hoppy. Overall good flavor. All the traditional flavors plus aggressive hops. Very nice. Thanks to my man Dilger.

Beer# 500, Thanks to Bu11zeye! Thank you!.
Bottle, pours a very nice gold with white head. Aroma was extremly nice, very fruity with faint acidity. Flavor is malty, fruity, with a orange peel type bitter. Has a med-full mouthfeel with med-high carbonation....Overall, this is a VERY good beer, excellent, is now one of my favorites! Very easy to drink....
Pours cloudy golden with a medium frothy head.  Very lacy.  Aroma is very spicy.  Taste of cloves and citrus hops.  A touch of grapefruit peeks through.
Poured a dark yellow with a large head, light aroma. fruity notes of orange, lemon, and hops.

Bottle pours cloudy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of orange and butterscotch. Begins sweet with hints of Orange, lemon, Clove, and Cinnamon. Finishes with slightly bitter hops and noticeable alcohol burn. Great beer!

Poured a cloudy yellow color with a grapefruit nose.This was slightly hoppier than I prefer for hefeweizen, but it is an imperial.Flavor was grapefruit, hoppy and slightly bitter.I would like to revisit this beer again because it was interesting.

bottle thanks to iowaherkeye.   murky gold pour with  thin off white head.  oranges, alcohol and bananas on the nose.  not too thick on the palate and a very smooth flavor of fruits that finish quite smooth with a hint of clove.  the alcohol isn’t too well hidden though.

This one poured in a dark orange manner with a pillowy head that dissipated quickly.  I noticed  lot of cloves (but not excessive) followed by the tempering of the cinnamon.  The hops then rang through to finish refreshingly.  It also went down fairly easily, although this is not meant to be a session beer.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text:
In short: An intense (not highly drinkable) very-spicy Weizen on steroids.  Good but just too much for its own good.
How: Bottle 12oz, first batch, drank 4 months after bottling.  From sunevdj, thanks a lot Sune
The look: Opaque peach color topped by a small white head
In long: Strong and complex nose, spicy, fruity and lots of hay.  Taste is a lot of dry straws, some banana cake, bubble gum, a lot of cloves and a lot of other herbal spices, some crunchy white sugar, dry orange and lemon peels, a lot of dry bitter hops.   Aggressive carbonation.  Overall this beer is dry dry dry.  9.6% somewhat apparent.  This is a very tasty brew, so tasty in fact that Id even say this is an aggressive beer.  Its intensity really turned me on with the first few sips but by the end of the bottle I thought the beer was a bit too much especially in the cloves and spices department.  Its a good beer but not a very good beer and certainly not an excellent beer like the current ratings indicate.  But thats how it goes on ratebeer: intensity=quality But Im rating beer, not sex.
pours orange and hazy aromas of cloves and hops lots of hops tastes of hops wow very hoppy and fruit, cloves, a hefeweizen on steroids very powerful and bold

Bottle.  Cloudy, orange/yellow pour with a thick frothy head that dissipated quickly.  Sweet, fruity aroma of banana and pineapple.  Similar flavor as well as wheat, citrusy hops, clove and some alcohol in the finish.  Plenty of carbonation as well.  Very interesting beer and very enjoyable!

12 oz bottle.  Poured a golden amber color, decent off-white head.  Aroma was cloves and wheat, primarily.  Flavor was wheat, wheat, wheat, some cinnamon and citrus flavors as well.  The alcohol flavor was also very present, but it complemented the spices nicely.  Palate was a bit too thick for the flavor, but overall its something I would come back to.

Poured from a 12oz bottle and served in a weizen glass.  This beer poured an attractive, hazy golden orange with a thick, lasting creamy beige head.  Excellent lacing.  The aroma of the beer was made up of stong bananas, bubblegum, mild clove, fresh oranges, and wheat.  I could take in this aroma all day!  The flavor consisted of wheat, lemon, oranges, cloves, mild banana, as well as some strong alcohol.  The mouthfeel was medium to full-bodied with light, soft carbonation.  A really cool take on a hefe.  Quite enjoyable.  The alcohol was a little upfront, but not totally overpowering.

Bottled sample, via (and consumed with) oakbluff. Golden in colour with faint haze and moderate carbonation. Aromas of bubblegum, flowers, plastic, and malted wheat. Flavors are citrusy-floral, along with strong notes of nutmeg, clove, and hand soap. Dries out surprisingly well for a hefe. I found the spicing to be a little heavy handed, but balancing the abv and wheatbeer flavors was done pretty well. Not bad overall.
Bottle- golden hue with  cloud white head and nice lacing. Nose- very spicy. tons of clove. Taste- overpowering spice, quite hot.  Finishes very dry, medium carbonation.

Before Sune (sunevdj) came out to San Diego, he made quite the tour of the beer world.  This is one beer he brought along the trip, and he kept it with him to share with us at toncatchers tasting.  Lots of banana and clove on this rather dark golden beer.  Some bitterness that I hadnt expected on the aromas, but the flavor was more classic hefe.  Pretty darn good.

Bottle shared by sliffy.   Pours hazy golden color with a nice fluffy white head.   Aroma is banana, bubble gum, grains, light citrus.   Flavor is floral, apricot, banana, bubble gum, grain.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finished crisp and clean.   Great brew, one of the best hefes Ive had.

Bottle, big thanks to CaptainCougar.  Beautiful, beautiful pour: Bright hazy deep golden orange with a thin but lasting gauzy head.  One of the best looking beers Ive seen, honestly.  Bananas, a kind of bubble gum aroma, cloves, spicy orange peel, and lemon cleaning fluid on the nose... but not really in a bad way.  Oh, and lest I forget the hops.  They assert themselves nicely. Bright but stringent aroma.  More of the same on the palate with more banana, yeast, and even more hops, ending with a bitter hops and warming alcohol zing.  A little soapy at the end there, but lingering banana and citrus on the back of the palate for awhile after...

This poured a cloudy golden orange in color with a thick head of medium-sized bubbles.  There is lots of banana and clove in the nose along with yeast and a touch of citrus.  In the mouth orange rind makes an apperance and the yeast overtakes the banana and clove.  The palate is medium-bodied with good carbonation and a dry/bitter finish.  I think this one will actually drink a bit better in 6 months, which would make it a great Fall beer.

Pours a golden hazy color with a large frothy off white head. Nose of wheat, clove, bubble gum, banana and touch of citrus.  Initial taste of nutmeg, banana, clove and good balancing wheat.  Mid palate displays lemon peal. Finishing with good balancing hop bitterness, wheat, and clove. Touch of warmth from the alcohol that is very impressive for its 9.6%. Lots of spices still lingering in the palate duration. Good palate, medium body with microbubble mouthfeel. Good head retention and spot lacing of the glass. Absolutely fantastic. Refreshing and flavorful.
If an IPA and a wheat beer spawned this would be it.  It was literally like you mixed the two together.  Dan Carey is amazing.  So is Danny Carey (drummer-Tool).

Nice large head that sticks a half inch out of the top of my glass.  Very good carbonation and fantastic head retention.  Aroma of oranges and wheat with some spices and suprisingly some banana bread.  Color is a cloudy golden orange.  Wow, great big oranges in the flavor with lots of wheat and sweet malts.  Alcohol stands up in front of you and politely smacks you across the face.  More spices and lemon.  Finishes warming and sweet with a little hops bitterness and orange peel.  I am a BIG fan of this brew.  Got to find me some more of these.

12 oz bottle, shared a 4-pack with my dudebra CarytheDude. Pours a stunning hazy goldish orange, with a fluffy white head. Aroma of orange and other citrus, banana, spice, powdered sugar. Taste is citrus and spice with a great crisp hop finish. The mouthfeel is full and bright. Overall, if youre like me and find most weizens boring, this great brew will floor you.

What a disappointment, this one. Though awesome bubble gum and banana notes smack you in the face upon first pour, the booziness to this one is almost unreal. Furthermore, that awesome aroma dies down into almost nothing after sitting for 20 minutes -- a reality, since its so hard to drink. Flavors are mushy, overloaded with spices, and gristly. This just didnt do it for me.
12oz bottle @Noogfest4.0-pours a thin off white head and hazy gold color.  Aroma is lemon, yeast, spice-coriander, pepper, sweet.  Taste is lemon, yeast, spice-coriander, pepper, metallic/dry.

Pours an absolutely gorgeous unfiltered orange/amber color with a nice white head.  The smell is very spicy with a lot of citrus and banana.  There was an aroma I was trying to place and couldnt for the first half of the beer, but then it hit me.  This beer smells exactly like Double Bubble bubble gum.

Flavor is like your typical wheat beer, only turned up to 11.  Great flavor, but that double bubble smell took away from it a little bit.  Nice mouthfeel and really great finish.

Good beer.

Tasted at Noogfest 4.0 (2008). This weizen pours a slightly medium gold color from a 12oz bottle. Medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is wheaty, banana and clove. Medium bodied weiss. The malts are cereal, banana and clove with some grain. The hops are earthy. Its not really a hefe and its not a wheat wine, but somewhere in between. I wont try and classify it, but it has that typical New Glarus mouthfeel and balance. Interesting beer, Hides the alcohol very well. Mouthfeel si full. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Thanks sliffy, Bottle:  Pale golden pour with very spotty lacing.  Aroma is banana, clove, and allspice and sweet in the nose, almost like Teaberry gum.  Flavor is a squeeze of lemon underneath a dark spiciness with a bitter and very warm finish.  Solid, if not a little hot.
user_location: I F&ckin hate those guys from, Ohio, USA

text: Impressive. This hefeweizen grabs you by the short and currlys. Its not that its strong, but rather that its bold. Pulls you in with a beautiful peach colored appearance, and a nice frothy head with excellent lacing. Then you smell it tand the seduction begins. Then you take a drink of it and its like a chuck norris spin kick of, citrus and spice. Very nice indeed.

Courtesy fantomas23. This one poured out a bright yellowish orange color with a thick, bubbly white head. The head recedes slowly and leaves nice lacing around the glass. The aroma is really nice of orange citrus, banana, clove, nutmeg, and a good amount of hops. The flavor follows suit with the orange citrus and banana up front followed by the nutmeg and clove mixed in with a touch of malt sweetness. The hops make their presence known on the backend adding a good amount of earthy bitterness to the flavor. This is one hopped up hefe. The mothfeel is medium almost full bodied that is really easy to drink with a long, dry, bitter finish. This is definitely one to enjoy fresh as it is really good right now and a damn fine hefe at that.
hazy yellow. Seems to glow. Slightly harsh finish, but has nice citrus and green banana.

Bottle courtesy of Oakbluff: Poured a cloudy beige color weizen with a big foamy head with good retention and good lacing. Aroma of spicy yeast with loads of cloves and wheat malt note. Taste is a mix between some cloves with some huge wheat malt note with a spicy yeast note at the end. Full body with limited filtration and some good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Really like this beer but thought it was a bit cloying at some point and maybe a less extreme version would have been more appreciated.

A cloudy yellow apperance with a rather large white head. The aroma is hoppier than I imagined with some cloves, lemons, and pine. The flavor is rather sweet with some lemons, cloves, wheat, and oranges. Probably better in small amounts but overall a pretty good beer.

Bottle.  I was a bit let down by this one.  Pours a hazy orange body with a  white head.  Aroma is hops spices light fruit and wheat.  Flavor was heavily hopped and tasted a bit like detergent.  Some spices, moderate etoh.

A- Pours a gorgeous orangey peach color with a decadent, white, billowy head.

S- Most weizens seem to be light on the nose ... this one sure isnt! Very floral, piney hops, cloves, bits of banana, smells almost spicey.

T- Taste is much milder than the nose lets on. The clove and banana come out quite a bit and the perfumey floral scent is suppressed in the taste which I like. Definitely bitter on the back end but the hops dont seem to play a huge part in the flavor.

M- Perhaps a bit too thick and not quite crisp enough.

D- This is definitely an Imperial Hefeweizen. This beer started out perfect for me and started to drop off towards the end. The thick mouthfeel and lingering bitterness turn me off to this one a bit but I still enjoyed it very much.

Todds Tasting!  Thanks Todd! Orange hues with a fluffy off white head.  Fruity esters and clove on the nose.  Alcohol was extremely well masked.  Columbus hops and banana up front.  Bitter lemon finish.

12 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Poured a hazy apricot color with a frothy, long lasting white head.  Medium amount of carbonation.  Nice lacing down the sides of the glass.  The aroma was of cloves, banana, wheat, orange, and a touch of honey.  The taste backs up what was the aroma presented.  Had a nice bitter finish and had the characteristics of a nice clean hefeweizen finish.  The 9.6% ABV was also nicely masked.  Very nice beer.

Bottle from KingpinIPA. Cloudy apricot color with massive fluffy head. Aroma was spicy with lemon and hop notes. Taste was the same. Thick and full bodied with bitter spicy finish. Not real refreshing, but good never the less.

12oz bottle.  Aroma of yeast, citrus, bananas, and wheat.  Hazy orange sparkling hue with a huge foamy white head that left great lace.  Flavor is spicy yeast, wheat, citrus and finishes bitter.    Palate is lively and medium bodied.  Quite crisp.  Not bad but not my style.

On the pour I was thinking this is a pretty dope beer. Nose was initially all c-hops then came the hefe smells, cloves and bananas, some citrus. Very pretty orangey yellow with fluffy offwhite head. Mouthfeel is a bit thin, but thats probably due to how dry this beer is. Nice hoppiness that fits in well with the burly hefe flavors. A very nice beer, though hardly a true German Hefe, Id have went with a wheat ale...

12oz bottle.

I generally take fidelity to style into consideration when rating a beer, but since its not really practical in this case, I rated simply by how much I enjoyed it.

Pours a hazy apricot hue with massive, gigantic pillowy head. WAY too much carbonation -- the head from half a pour just kept building and building until eventually spilling over. A lot of this beer ended up on my kitchen counter, which pisses me off considering how much I paid for this bottle. Aroma gives up a huge, unsubtle burst of piney, flowery hops, bananas, clove and a bit of Sweet-tarts. While this odd hybrid works on the nose, it doesnt work very well for me on the palate. The commercial description is not kidding when it warns that "dry hopping boldly rules over" the wheat and the yeast. It starts out OK at first, letting the more traditional hefeweizen characteristics make a showing, but the aftertaste is so hoppy that its reminiscent of dish soap. I know a lot of hop-heads like that kind of thing but I dont, especially when it otherwise could have been an intriguing flavor combination. Palate is thinnish as per a hefeweizen and tingly with carbonation.

An interesting flavor combination with a lot of potential, but the execution was just too much of a slap in the face to be really enjoyable.
Cloudy, golden color.  Smell of hops, malt, pine, bananas, clove, pine and alcohol.  Taste of banana cream pie, pine, hops,malt, clove, pepper and alcohol.

Pours a bright hazy golden yellow with a huge billowy three finger head that hangs around for ages leaving great lacing.  This is what a hefe should look like.  Huge nose on this with the sweet wheat, yeast and massive spiciness interacting beautifully.  Not to mention the big banana aroma with lemon zest.  Wow, this is a seriously big aroma for a hefe.  Big wheat taste up front which gives way to the spices - cloves are the showcase in the middle.  The spice gives way to the lemon zest and orange peel in the finish with a hop bitterness.  I didnt get too much banana in the taste compared to the smell.  Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth but, with the carbonation and the spice, there is a serious zing on the tongue.  This is certainly one of the better hefeweizens Ive ever tasted.  The spiciness is pretty big so the drinkability isnt quite what it could be.  However, this is, without a doubt, the most complex brew Ive ever tasted in this style.  Highly recommended!

Bottle from trade with ThaBobfather. Pours a hazy dark amber hue with a large frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with good lacing.  Good wheat, clove and banana aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Medium well balanced spicy flavor with a good bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Good drinkable beer.

Opened the bottle with a nice pop of the cap and poured into my glass carefully, but the head still grew too large to fill the glass with beer.  Color is a cloudy amber-orange. Aromas of freshly mashed bananas with an earthy hay-like aroma that has bits of citrus and bits of clove in it.  Flavors of toasted malt are prominent, along with some bitterness and lots of banana, clove and other esters rising into nose.   The citrus flavors from the hops go well with the banana and other esters from the wheat beer, but the bitterness feels odd, combined with the alcoholic bite in the finish, it leaves the mouth feeling not refreshed like a good wheat beer usually does or like a nice IPA can.  Mouthfeel is full and body is very chewy.

Now just based on appearance alone in a blind tasting this looks just like a German hefe.  Until the nose, then you get the dry hopped citrus aromas.  The palate boldly walks the line between an imperial IPA and a real living German hefe.  The yeast is predominant in all points of the beer, a beautiful hazy unfiltered appearance, spicy nose and lots of bubblegum, and clove nuances on the palate.  One of the most nicely done beers in the Unplugged series.  It would be even better in my opinion if they toned the hops down, I am one of those people that believes the addition of large amounts of hops does not make a beer better.  Having said that, normally I would mark a beer down because I am a style nazi, but for what Dan was going for this gets greats marks, but bottom line tastes like an IPA, made with a German yeast strain.

Bottle shared by emacgee and aubreya.  Thanks yall!  Wowzers, says Ethan as he opens this, the first bottle in our mini (mostly ) sour tasting. Pours a cloudy orange golden with a thick white head. Nose is yeast, wheat, hops, and alcohol. Flavor is spicy and sharp with a lot of hops in there not very typical of a german hefe.  I found this to be pretty good, but I think it really lacked the refreshing, wheaty, yeast quality I like in my hefes. I understand its a different beer and kind of a hybrid or sorts, but I guess I was just hoping for something a little different.

12 oz. bottle received in trade - Pours a hazy golden color with a large off white head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is spicey esters (light banana and yeast) and light citrus.  Flavor is full of esters and spice.  Medium body.  Smooth palate.  A very good beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy orangish body with a foamy two finger light beige head that had excellent retention.  The nose is heavy doughy wheat with lesser impact from the yeast.  Theres a really odd amount of Cascade hops here as well that seems really out of place.  The yeast derived spiciness does emerge a little more the more I smell it though, with lots of clove, some cinnamon, and some allspice.  Intense yet weird aroma.  The flavor is full-on intense clove spiciness.  This really, really, reminds me of clove cigarettes.  The wheat is almost lost with all the yeast character going on here.  Cinnamon, bright Cascade hop bitterness, spicy alcohol, and a touch of banana very late in the finish.  Mouthfeel is full bodied with a slight bread dough stickiness that might get a bit bothersome were it not for the fizzy effervescent carbonation.  Overall, a fairly decent beer, but like the Bourbon Barrel Bock, not one that I could drink multiple bottles of.

Huge thanks to dkachur for sending this one my way.  Pours a medium towards dark hazy gold, great lasting head.  Aroma is just huge, a blast of clove accented by grapefruit citrus.  Flavor matches - clove dominates, along with citrus hop, an interesting play of German yeast and American hopping.  Finish is reminiscent of weizenbock with the big wheat flavor.  Fascinating.  Not sure it would be a "go to" beer for me, but definitely an interesting brew.  Not entirely sure cloves and citrus play well together.

Thanks a ton Iowaherkeye. Pours a bright hazy yellow orange with a 1-2 finger creamy yellow head. The nose is citrusy, shows some lemongrass, banana, spicy, cloves, light alcohol. The flavor is very sharp and spicy, light alcohol, some banana, lemongrass, seems very hoppy, not what I was expecting. Has a very sharp and spicy palate. The finish is kind of complex, starts off warm, then you get an initial burst of wheat and banana, followed by a prolonged hot spicy feel. In the end, not what I was expecting or wanted from an Hefeweizen. Very similar to Brooklyner-Schneider Hopfen Weisse and should be listed as a Weizen Bock.

Certainly packs a punch.  Pours a beautiful cloudy orange-gold with a fluffy head.  Spices, cloves, bananas, and butterscotch on the nose.  Flavor is overwhelmingly complex but balanced at the same time.  Damn good weizen.

12 oz bottle courtesy petrucci914. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a thick billowing white head. Big floral citrus aroma, kind of like a creamsicle. Thick malty taste with lots of bitter hops. Hops are really nice and citrusy bitter. Finishes with a bitter bite, yet creamy. Wow, a really neat beer.

Pours the standard golden haze of hefes.  The aroma is not very true to the wheats though.  Its very fruity and sweet with some booze.  Not much hay and clove.  I like that in my hefe.  Odd aroma of yeast too.  The flavor is pretty solid though.  Fruity with wheats.  Not very chewy and a bit boozy.  I enjoy it though.  Finishes dry with a bitter from hops.

Bottle courtesy of theisti. Pours a hazy light amber with a large, pillowy, ivory head that lasts for a long time. Once it does diminish, it leaves behind beautiful, delicate lace. The nose is quite nice: cloves, sweet spice and piny/citric hops over a solid wheat backing. The mouthfeel is full-bodied, slick and lightly tart with at a somewhat sour finish that leaves a slight warming sensation in your chest. This is easily the fullest bodied wheat that Ive ever sampled. The flavor is of sweet/sour wheat, cloves, candy sugar and bitter, piny and slightly citric hops. The flavor isnt quite as well integrated as the nose might have projected, but its fairly tasty. As a fan of wheat, especially hoppy wheats, I rather enjoyed this one. Thanks again for giving me this one, Tim.

Disappointing. Aroma is pretty standard. Not much zestiness, fairly sweet, fruity. Taste is rather overwhelming with fake cherry cough syrup and booze-not like a boozy burn that makes you cringe, just booze flavor. Rather unpleasantly tart. The bitter finish is somewhat redeeming. Body is full, but carbonation is lacking. Nice experiment and I think an imperial hefe could be good, but this isnt it.

Bottle from Ryan, thanks fool.  Damn, after hearing Ryan talk my fucking ear off about how good this beer is over Xbox Live, I thank the one above that he finally got around to sending me some.  I could resist drinking this for around 30 minutes after getting home.  Pours out an orange color with a huge white head on it.  Very nice.  The smell is something full of banana, lemon, malts, and some slight hop smells with a little bit of alcohol.  Very pleasing smell and look so far; very good!  Taste is something incredible, just what a hefe should be: sweet, smooth, easy to drink, refreshing, hoppy, no alcohol detected, just all around awesome.  Is it possible that a little brewery in Wisconsin can brew better Hefeweizen than the Germans?  Yes.  I do believe it is possible.  I have certainly never had a hefe this good.  Awesome beer.

12oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy dreamsicle color  with a billowy white head.  Aroma is spicy and sweet, with strong notes of hoppy citrus, coriander, cloves, peach, banana, and a bit of malt.  Taste is full and creamy, with a sweet initial flavor of hops, banana, and candy opening up into a long finish of coriander, cloves, yeast, and a twinge of warming alcohol.  A divine and inspired brew.

A tart and slightly bitter aroma, like that of orange pith. The head is light and frothy; hue is somewhere between pale orange and maple.
Remarkably complex flavor, tasting strongly of ripe peach, butterscotch, and a great deal of hops. Finish is long and somewhat sour, reminding one of tangerine.
Would do best as a dessert beer perhaps along side an exceptionally dark chocolate.
12oz pours with a great white head, and a nice gold color.  Has a nice clove, hop and alcohol aroma and taste.  a nice spicy after taste.

12 oz, Pours to a great sparkling pillowy soft head that really shimmers in the light. Great gold color with a nice haze to it that makes it look delicious. Recedes to a millimeter thick head with some lacing. Smells of banana, bubble gum, small amounts of hops and spices. Taste is crisp wheat and spices, bubbley and alive. Great weizen.
Opaque yellow, with not much head.  Woody, slightly citrusy hop nose with some banana and light nutmeg.  Fun- really piney, limey, bubblegummy, with light spicy, yeast and alcohol, too.

Cloudy honey-like orange color with thinnish head that clings to the sides of the glass.

Sweet and sugary, banana, circus peanuts, Extra bubblegum, slight impression of alcohol.

Big taste caught me off guard. Dry and almost bitter or tannic impression. Lots of citrus; somewhat odd flavor/feel. Almost hot and spicy feel thats not very appealing to me.

Decently drinkable, considering the alcohol content.

Bottle huge thanks to wetherel! Aroma is great, packed full of citrusly orangy peel and lemmon hop, wheat is evedent and as it warms peppery alcohol comes through too. Taste is similar when in the mouth, but once swallowed the wheaty clove orange character are actually fighting with the near iipa hoppyness, causaeing a very confusing and annoying flavour to finish. This stays the whole beer which tells me one of two things. Get rid of the wheat and youve got a hot iipa. Or get rid of the hops and youve got an hot wheat wine. Either would be great for me, but not together. I still think this is a fairly drinkable beer for the strength, like its probably easier than bigfoot, but that finish just really got in the way.

Bottle at Toncatchers tasting. Poured a murky yellow gold with a big white head. The nose was all spices-- dominated by cloves and a bit orange peel. The flavor was spicy with white pepper, citrus and vanilla. The mouthfeel was silky smooth. The finish was long with lingering cloves. Overall: A very saison-like weizen, very tasty.

12oz bottle with thanks to Tyler (tytoanderso) for this Wants List bonus!  Pours a murky golden with a large and persistent fluffy white head, great lacing.  Aroma is orange peel, banana, lemon zest, and coriander.  Flavor is banana, orange, lemon and more coriander.  I guess that might be cloves there, but its the first time Ive tasted it in a beer and it kept itself in a complimentary place rather than taking over and ruining everything for me.  Palate is bright, crisp and engaging.  Encouraging for my first Hefeweizen, and a nice one from NG. Thanks again Tyler!

Much thanks to hopdog for passing this one onto me. Pours a hazy golden orange with a big rocky/foamy white head that left tons of sticky lacing.  Aroma of banana, clove, lemon, orange peel, wheat and a touch of alcohol.  Flavor was a nice mix of that same banana, clove, wheat, some sweet maltiness and a touch of alcohol.  I like this imperial version of a Hefe!

12 bottle courtesy of Ughsmash. Aroma was odd some burnt bread but also had some good clove and citrus on the nose. Hazy gold body with good white ceamy foam head and plenty of lacing. Flavor was good citrus lemon bitter zip along with some vanilla to thicken the body texture up. Medium bitter bite but a good palatable Hefe. Thanks Jason.

Sent as an extra from goryshekwych. Thanks George! An awesome wheat beer. Pours a hazy orange/red with a 1/2 inch head. Aromas of banana, clove, and Cascade Hops. Almost has enough hops to compete with some IPAs in terms of the nose. Flavors of banana, clove, bubble gum, pretty big grapefruit, and some alcohol. This is a nice fruity beer and I really enjoy how the Cascade hops complement the Bavarian yeast. All things considered, it is very drinkable and that is scary at 9.6%. One of the best hefes I have ever had. More please.
Bottle. Interesting nose, hard to pin down. Coriander, clove, bubblegum, and a vague acidity. Cloudy yellow with a thick bubbly head. Creamy with a candy-like sweetness punctuated by spice.

Appearance: Pours a cloudy, golden body with a small, fizzy, white head.

Smell: Aroma very nearly stinking of coriander with lesser notes of toasted banana chips, tangy-smelling wheat, and grapefruit juice.

Taste: Tangy wheatiness with a dash of citric grapefruit juice hot on its heels. Then, its back to wheat with a subdued sweetness, though it builds upon warming. Flavors of banana and a big hit of coriander. Medium-high bitterness. Some floral hints prior to the tangy, bittersweet finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Moderate carbonation.

Drinkability: Pretty exciting for wheat!
Pours hazy golden with off-white head.  Way too many items to list for the aroma... ditto for the flavor.  Tasty & potent!

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2008 Wow, Dark fruits throughout.. Not just in aroma but also in flavor. Full bodied, thick. Such an interesting beer, hardly your average hefe though. I wish this was distributed in Ohio. Sampled at FFF on Dark Lord day 2008.
Holy smokes, what a Hefe!!  Best Ive ever had.  Rich, creamy, loaded with banana, cloves, and citrus...  Very strong as well.  Careful with this one...

12oz Bottle

Recieved this in a recent trade with Mully, thanks again Matt for the great trade! A beautiful pour of a hazed golden. After I swirled the bottle and finished the pour a fog like haziness slowly overtook the polished golden. A soft pour produced an off-white two + finger meringue like head that only fell a half finger and left some really great webbed lacing on its way. A great looking brew!

Wow! Intense spiciness in the nose. Big bold clove, banana,orange peel, and lemon greet the nose right away and pretty much dominate. There is a white pepper spiciness in there. Whatever strain of yeast they used....damn, did it create some big aromas. A little too big on the spiciness for my liking.

Theres a hint of banana on the finish but its not nearly as strong as the nose suggested. The wheat base is evident with a twang upfront before it cools down and lets the fruit come through. Big orange peel and clove mid-palate eventually die down and the wheat twang shows itself again on the swallow. A kind of dusty/chalky yeastiness comes through every now and then. A big weizen without a doubt!

The body is a hefty medium with a little stick in the back of the throat. Silky body with a healthy massaging carbonation.

The spiciness in here is so big that one bottle in a sitting is enough for me. With that being said, its still an enjoyable brew. 

New Glarus does a great job with everything, but especially their wheat beers. Although hefes arent my favorite style this is another good one although maybe a touch over the top. Ive fallen in love with their Unplugged Series!

4/21/08

12 oz. bottle. Powerful, sharp, sour, salty, yeasty aroma. Scents of lemon, bubblegum, pickle brine, crabapple, and white wine. Stings the nostrils. Pours a brilliant, cloudy, bright orange. Moderate amount of off-white head. Produces some lacing. Looks awesome! Boozy taste, like a complex version of gin and orange juice, somehow reminiscent of Duvel (but much better). Plum, grape bubblegum, and cotton candy flavors. The taste has the same salty, briny, lemony sharpness as the aroma has. Dry finish. Bitter aftertaste. Medium to heavy body. Oily, lively, sharp, and frothy in the palate. Imperial Weizen is a challenging, unique, and interesting brew. Im very impressed. Its not an every day beer, but with all the great beer out there, theres no way Im going to be drinking the same beer every day anyway. Thanks to tennisjoel for providing me with this bottle.

12oz bottle acquired in a couple of trrades. Poured a deeper and cloudy golden color with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of bananas, cloves, and citrus. Tastes of bananas, light bubble gum, cloves, and citrus. Some alcohol in the finish.

Pours a hazy orange with a light off-white head and nice lacings. Very sweet. Aromas of wheat, bubble gum and peacheas. Also hints of alcohol, citrus fruits and raisins. Very full bodied with a sticky mouthfeel. High carbonation. Gives (nice citric hoppy burbs.)

Poured a hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of banana, cloves, toffee, honey, floral hops, citrus fruits, almonds, and alcohol.  Taste of more honey, some citrus fruits, hop bitterness, vanilla, light nuts, and alcohol.

12 oz bottle.  Clouded apple juice with a thick ivory head that ends up like a float.  Nose is wheat, lemon grass, orange peel, ginger, clove and coriander.  Imperial aroma for sure.  A sharp and tangy bite cuts through the wheat smoothness.  Taste is concentrated wheat paste with green banana, orange and clove.  Finishes dry with bitter spice; a bit medicinal.  An interesting experiment but hot for a weizen or maybe thats the point.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2008 Pours a cloudy golden yellow with big thick frothy white head. This is a Weizen on steroids. Huge banana, clove, citrus. Perfect balance between all elements. High alcohol content is balanced by thick body. Crisp, refreshing, smooth. Everything a weizen should be. This is one of Dan Carreys finest achievements. It is rare to find a weizen of this quality in the states.

Wow, good stuff. Lots of banana, and orange in the aroma. Great blend of hops, with some pepper and more banana on the pallate. Im not a wheat beer fan in general, but i make an exception for this tasty NG brew. This was more like a banana IPA, and its works!

Bottle thanks to CMUBEERMAN. Pours hazy opaque apricot, white head. Aroma is citrusy, spicy, and tangy. Flavor is filled with spices (coriander and nutmeg) citrus, tangy dried fruits, and hops. An interesting combination.

thanks to fantomas!  Big clove and spices in the aroma, with hints of pine.  Pours cloudy golden orange with a thick white head.  Wow, my mouth doesnt know what to make of it?  is a big ipa or a hefe?  Man the best of both worlds collide here, Very wheaty with banana and strong clove, with an intense bitterness and hints of citrus and piney hops.  Awesome beer!

12 oz bottle purchased at Chicones in Hudson, Wisconsin. Pour is a hazy orange golden with a big 3 inch off white head which is quite lasting. Aroma of strong cloves, yeast and bubble gum. Some sweet citrus spiciness. Taste has the traditional Hefe flavors, wheat, banana, bubblegum and yeastiness. It also has a sharp ear wax bitterness (grapefruit peel) and a fair amount of heat in the finish.  Palate is nice and full and creamy. I guess I just dont like these big Hefes as much as the next guy. Just didnt seem completed to me.

Bottle purchased at Woodmans.    Damn, this is one big "Banana Shake".  If I didnt know about the yeasts, I would swear this was a banana fruit beer.  Powerhouse, and what you would expect from New Glarus.

12oz bottle from drewbeerme - thanks, Andrew!!! Another killer from the great Dan Carey, and Id say this is probably the impy weizen that most closely approximates its original style without compromising its extremity. You get that lovely cloudy body and big refreshing taste from the unfiltered brew. The spices are not overbearing or excessively sweet, and the body is nicely full. The kick comes with the abundant hopping and it provides a nice bite at the outset and again at the finish. Really interesting and complex beer, another winner from NG.

12 oz. bottle - thanks to drewbeerme for the trade; wow, this beer was just a delight from start to finish; pours cloudy light orange with thin white head maintaining throughout the surface; bready and fruity aromas - peaches, lemons, yeast and slightly sour; lovely texture to it that reminds me of HotD brews; slight zing to the flavors and drinks with a warm fuzz; sweet flavors of pineapple and wheat; i cant wait for another bottle!!

Thanks to iowaherkeye for this one - pours a cloudy glowing orange/gold, with some frothy bubbles on top - assertive nose of lemon zest, banana, clove, coriander, cardamom, wildflowers, orange peel - very complex, and very powerful - thick, creamy mouthfeel - a bit peppery and spicy and first - the peppery character lasts throughout, and combines with the alcohol presence to make the beer quite warming - cardamom, coriander, and other spices that remind me of indian food, which is rather odd for this style, but it works fairly well - some honey sweetness, banana, and citrus - the sweetness gets cut off abruptly by rather strong hopping, which doesnt quite work with the other qualities of the beer - the wheat makes its presence known through a gentle earthy tartness in the background - a wee bit of acidity at the end - it doesnt come together as well as it could, but its a pretty nice beer.

Bottle (12oz).  Shared with garthicus, courtesy of swoopjones.  Hazy orange with a decent fizzy white head.  Sweet candy and fruit (apple, pear, mango), with literally tons of pungent peppery yeast and dry juniper hops - moderate alcohol.  Taste has all those characteristics, but quite lively and aggressive - in a good way - acidic and nicely carbonated - extremely well done, massive!

HogTownHarrys bottle, shared with Harry! Beautiful milk-orange colour a lovlely snow white head. Orange & yeast aroma, such floral notes, fruity. Flavour: Like a rock shandy with mango and hops, a wonderful underlining yeast element that just sky rockets it to greatness. Thanks for sharing Harry... superb.

Bottle via swoopjones - thanks! Pours a cloudy dark golden with a big-ass white head. Crazy aroma, sitting somewhere between a hefeweizen, a saison, and a hop-driven IPA - yeast, spices (cloves, coriander), banana, hops, lemon, a slight funkiness. Flavour is just as varied and complex. I tried to wrap my head around it for a bit, but eventually just sat bak and enjoyed it. Fantastic!

bottle: pours cloudy golden dark hay colour with a large white porous head some lacing.  aroma is great like an ipa meets a hefe wiezen, great characters of a wheat beer like clove ,banana, wheat, and touches of the bubblegum. then on top of all that is a wonderful fresh floral hops. flavour is a good bitter hop then wheat malts, some spice (clovey), citrus peel. finiahes with a sharp bitter. fantastic beer.

Too peppery,  Too spicey.   Too wheaty.   Just too much hefeweizen going on for my buds.   Bananna trie to help come in and save the flavor but everything is just so extreme leaving for a very mediocre experience.

btl thanks to kingpinipa. Slightly hazed golden/orange pour with alot of off white head and lace. Spicey aroma centers around corriander and then just other spices. Flavor mirrors aroma slight warmth woth a good bitter finish. The spice lingered after the drink was gone. More body than I expected. A very fine complex beer unique to say the least.
Pours a hazy opaque orange with a white head.  Smells of bubblegum, coriander, syrup.  Tastes of bananas, bubblegum, some spice, coriander, citrus.  Dry bitter finish.  Nice!

Tasted 4/5/08.  12oz bottle.  Hazy with a golden hue.  Finger width of white head.  Grassy citrus hop aromas.  Pineapple note.  Nice nose!  Rather full bodied with citrus wheat flavors.  Big effervescence.  Citrus bomb!  Sugary with a good burn.  Piney and tart.  Peachy and slightly vegetal.  Crisp and tingling.  Good wheat flavor with a nice dry finish.  Piney citrus grapefruit flavors.  Sweet bready notes.  Full rounded palate.  Fun drinking.

thanks drewbeerme!

great super phenol y clove and banana character in the nose...and it carried over well to the taste...and it hides the 9.6 alc really well...I sure would like more!

Bottle:  Big banana aroma with moderate bubblegum, citrus, yeast, and light citrus hops.  It pours a hazy orange with a small creamy white head.  The flavor starts with moderate citrus and banana.  It finishes with a moderate citrus hoppiness and light bubblegum.  It leaves a pretty big bubblegum aftertaste.  Medium bodied with mild and very soft carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2008 Bottle thanks to xnoxhatex.   Pours cloudy golden with a thin frothy white head with some craters.  Strong apple spice aroma,  doughy. [A lot better now than it was 35 beers into the WLV tasting... =p ]

(Bottle) Pours a hazy golden color with a copious amount of thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove and spice. Intense banana, bubble gum and spice in the taste. Light citrus and seemingly mild hop notes as well. Fine carbonation. Oily, thick mouthfeel. I would be interested to know what yeast strain was used in this beer, because it really brought out the wonderful flavor in this beer.
Pours a hazy yellow honey gold with a thick frosty white head.  Nice lacing.  Beautiful aroma of peppery clove and orange peel.  Taste of cloves, pepper, orange peel, honey and banana.  Excellent !!

Big hazy yellow, nice foamy head. I notice now that its 9.6%, no wonder my girlfriend was drunk after drinking 3 of em!  Flavor is big wheat, citrus fruit, some spice. Beautiful hop presence. No doubt that New Glarus has a lock on the big amazing wheat beers. Another solid brew from the crew at NG.
