Bottle: Pours a bright orange color with a puffy white head and a ton of lacing. Very nice carbonation. The nose is very phenolic with some spicy orange and grapefruit notes. Almost comes across as hops but its the yeast spiciness here. The flavor is chewy and malty with plenty of yeast, grass, hops and tasty wheat. The finish is fruity, like pear and clove. Yummy! Not much banana, but its quite nice with how intense the whole thing is. Thanks Jake!

Bottle, Merritt Island Throwdown. Pours totally opaque thick looking with white foam on top of orange/peach-colored body. Intense hopped up nose with orange and lots of pineapple. Inviting. Thin, silky, satin palate again with lots of pineapple juice. Fun stuff.

I received a bottle via trade, which I brought to hapjydeuce for a tasting, and he brought the same thing and so we opened his.  Thanks Justin!  Cloudy yelloe color.  Heavy body.  Nice thick white head.  Lots of fruity banana aroma.  Has kind of a spicy after taste on the tongue.  I wonder if that is from the cinnamon and clove.  The citrus is nice too, like a Hefeweizen, where the lemon has already been added.  Very drinkable.  I like it much better than Carnevale.  Yum!

(big thanks to ofortuna for this beer off of my want list.)beautiful orange/yellowish bosy with a thick white head.as the head sits i get some nice webbing on the glass.the aroma is full and complex.i grab bubble gum,hay,citrus hops,cloves,lemons,cinamon,and some caramel.the flavor is much of the same with the lemons really shining through.the mouth feel is a little fizzy for me.

bottle thanks to xnoxhatex. big thanks for this one  bud. Pours a beautiful deep golden color with intense fluffy rocky head. Nice stringy lacing all over the glass. Aroma is citrus and pepper, big berbal notes, banana and cloves, some vanilla. Flavor is hugely spice and peppery alcohol. The citrus begins to break through a little, but it has a lot to compete with. The alcohol is apparent but seems to mingle well amonst all the strong flavors. Theres a touch of bubblegum right before the herbally bitter kicks in leaving the mouth a little hop dry, nice! Body is medium with tingly carbonation. My first of the unplugged series and Im very impressed. thanks again to xnoxhatex for this bad daddy. Perhaps my favorite wheat beer yet.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow-copper with a large lasting frothy white head and nice lacing -- looks great! Aroma: First thing I notice is banana but theres lots more going on here: spices, plenty of hops, more fruit, wheat, yeast and more -- complex and awesome. Flavour: Very interesting, it starts sweet and hoppy followed by a spicy, bitter, slightly alcoholic finish. Some citrus, wheat and yeast in there too. The finish is a tad too spicy/bitter/boozy for my liking, but just by a touch. Medium bodied. Really good stuff, the aroma is fantastic and the flavours very good --  a few small adjustments and this would be amazing.

Bottled, shared at the PP Bottle Shop with wetherel and Sean. Slightly hazy blond pour with some medium-sized bubbly head. Great spicy aroma of dry hopping, coriander and orange citrus. Similar flavors of big citrus, clove and ginger spice leave a long-lasting sweet and tangy note in the mouth. Crisp and refreshing finish with a modest wheat-cereal flavored base. This is my first for this style; it didnt fail to impress.

Courtesy Beerlando.  Pours a cloudy gold color, with a small white head.  Smells of some wheat, but had a big hop presence which caught me a little off guard, along with some orange citrus.  The flavor is bigger on the wheat and orange combined, with the hops coming in more towards the finish.  Light hop bitterness lingered in the aftertaste.  Got some bubblegum notes in there too.  Very nice and interesting brew.  Quality offering.

Bottle from Ughsmash, thanks! Light orange color, cloudy. Flowery hoparomawith clove and tangerine. Firm hopbitter flowery and oily fklavor that oddly enough coincides well with the mandarine curacao, vanilla and banana flavors of the weizen. Slightly alcoholic vanilla pudding aftertaste.

Bottle from Discount Liquors, Milwaukee, WI.  Hazy orange with huge, puffy, LONG lasting white head.  Aroma is hoppy, citrus, orange, yeast, spice, cinnaman, a little banana, perfumy.  Sweet dirty spice and orange, yeast, a little alc, lime, hops, oh the hops!  Medium body and well carbonated but smooths to a puffy creaminess.   I was hoping for more but dirty alc and hops isnt as good as the other ratings might indicate.  Way too much alc and a little DMS.

Bottle GIABMISGFAB... Cloudy golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. Fruity, perfumy nose provides blasts of tropical and fuzzy fruits, bubblegum and cotton candy with lesser notes of clove and underripe banana. Medium-bodied and creamy with lively carbonation. Tart and tangy with banana sweetness and grapefruit rind bitterness. Bitter, earthy finish. Kudos to Beerlando for sharing this beer!

Bottle opened with a hiss, odd shrieking noise escaped from the foil. Poured into my trusty Dollartree Weizen glass with a giant head leaving behind plenty of lacing. Looks wonderful with my desk lamp shining behind it and all its Weizeny goodness.

Smells of Lemon, Banana, Clove, Grass and Black Pepper.

Im mostly tasting the citrus from the Cascades with a bit of Banana and Clove in the finish, they show up a bit more as it warms.

Awesome body and soft, lively carbonation.

Alright, who poured an SNPA in my Hefe? I wouldnt mind at all if the Cascades faded a bit. Id probably like it a bit more. Cascades arent my hop of choice. Its hard to tell that this is 8-9% ABV.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2008 Bottle. I traded for this from Ughsmash AND drewbeerme included it as an extra, so thanks to both of you guys! Pours a hazy peach color with a massive head and excellent lacing. Aroma is strong bubblegum and spice. Taste is citrus, green apple and spice, with a little bit of sourness. This seems like its lacking a little something, but is altogether pretty good. Ill be sure to rerate when I compare this to the other bottle (sorry, I wont, cause I gave it away,,, but the other one nailed a 4.1 rating, so it must have had that something... sorry I missed it but glad to spread the love...)Wow Wow Wow! It’s another bottle of imperial weizen, this time provided by the most generous mibirder. Thanks! Now for a proper rerate. Hazy peach color with very vigorous carbonation and a large head. Moderate retention and good lacing. Aroma is a clove and bubblegum with a bit of a hop bite and subtle caramel. Taste is surprisngly dry with notes of hops, bubblegum, banana, caramel, pear. Considerable tartness, a little cheesy, almost to the point of funk. Full bodied. Old rating 6/4/7/4/15; new rating 7/4/8/4/16.

Beautiful fusion of Imperial IPA and Hefeweizen.  Citrusy aroma mixed with cinnamon, clove and bananna.  Taste is a blend of citrusy smooth bitterness and toasted bananna.  Another Great unplugged from New Glarus.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Merritt Island Throwdown 08: Bottle, courtesy Beerlando. Pours a golden yellow color, with a fair amount of lacing and strong frothy head. Sweet aromas; bubblegum, wheat, some distant chalk, with a nice hoppy citrus profile and some cotton candy, too. Chalky texture on the tongue. Caramel, hoppy banana....clove...very sweet overall. Nice vanilla finish. Very tasty. Medium-bodied, and just delicious overall and easy to drink.

Thanks to my wife for picking this up for me while in Wisconsin!  Body color is cloudy orange with a very nice pillowy head.  Wonderful aroma of orange, clove, lemon, and banana.  I literally smelled this for a long time; it was powerful and it was good.  The flavor is nice, but more subdued than the aroma.  Still very nice.  New Glarus seems to rule America as far as wheat beers.  This one does not disappoint.  Yummy stuff!

Beautiful, hazed yellow sun with a hint of caramel interwoven in the unfiltered body. A stiff orange tinted head keeps rising over the top with a life of its own. Aroma could be the best Ive ever had. Righteous cloves with a equally prominent American c-hop flash. Lemon chiffon and vanilla buttercream treat with buttery baguettes a citric banana medley to the aromatic symphonys delight. The aroma is just about as bright and sweet as it gets. Flavor pipes in with an amplified affirmation of the preceding aromatic sequences. Cackled white pepper rides with sugar cloves for a bright, snappy soliloquy. Honeyed marigolds give a bright, herbal essence to the citric brightness from the c-note profile. The body builds to a heavy presence on the palate, presenting a hefty challenge for the tongue to heave it up after the bitterness and sweetness set into it. Tingly sensations of bright vanilla coated cloves intertwine with crushed white pepper and cackled cloves for a lively, bitter clean finish.

12oz bottle from Badbeer. Pours cloudy orange colored with a small white head of tiny bubbles that fades quick and leaves sheet lace. Smells of bread, yeast and banana. Tastes pretty heavy for a weizen, in a good way. Lots of banana and other big, bold sweet fruit flavors. Acidic up front and then it fades into a smooth sweetness on the finish. Full bodied, vibrant carbonation.

12 oz bottle from Discount Liquors.  Pours a hazy yellow with a tall off white head.  Nose is really strong bananas, yeast, cloves, and alcohol.  Flavors are slightly sweet.  More of the bananas, yeast, and cloves with lemons.  Creamy smooth with a touch of alcohol in the spicy dry finish.  This is a really tasty hefe-weizen.

This was a really good and tasty beer with hints of citrus and cloves and a strong alcohol present,very cloudy and head was a medium white that lasted awhile,not bad at all another good unplugged gem.CHEERS!

Hazy bronze with a high dense head. Complicated nose on this one, unpleasant at first, but it grows on me. Lemony, astringent hops, alcohol, heavy clove spiciness.Alcohol is apparent in the flavor, too. I wasnt sure at first the proper serving temp for a beer like this. Seems best at around 40 - 45F.
Many thanks to Skyview for this treat.  Unfortunately, mainly alcohol on the nose.  A cloudy body with sweet banana and wheat flavors.

pours a cloudy dark yellow with a huge three finger fluffy off white head. aroma is wheat and hops with citrus, bubble gum, and spruce. has a medium body with good lacing and descent carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma but stronger especially the spruce from middle to the aftertaste. has a creamy mouth-feel and a nice dry hop aftertaste. not to bad for my first impy Weiss and another good one from new glarus. i also get some cinnamon as well.

12oz.  Pours yellow with a massive white head.  The aroma on this thing is pretty awesome.  Hugely powerful aromas of hops, spice, banana, clove, yeast, bubblegum, earthiness.  The hop aroma reminds me of that oniony garlic flavor of columbus or summit though the bottle says cascade so perhaps that quality is just from the yeast.  Either way the aroma is huge and nice.  Taste is not quite up to par with the aroma.  The alcohol and overall bigness of the beer results in the drinkability suffering.  A little too bitter and harsh though still pretty good, just not as good as the smell.  I liked this a lot.

Bottle at home HUGE thanks to Ughsmash for this. 
Both settled and stirred its ever so lightly hazy and a nice orange colour, a bit deeper in colour in the stired version... WOW what a nose ... there the typical bubblegum baanana but wonderfully complimented with a huge mellow clove hoppyness ... taste is out there way out there... Id go so far to say possibly unique... banana bubble gum ... cloves loads of them ... quite sweet ... lots of citrus fruits (sherbert) lime and lemon with a big american hop finnish... SO an interesting and nicely drinkable brew that gets a few extra points, as ive had nothing like it before.... But may i complain about you Yanks and your lack of Alcohol content information... Whats with the Big secrets

Much thanks to kmeves for this fine brew. Very hazy honey color with rich, rocky head. Nose is bananas, cloves and cinnamon. Taste is fantastic blend of creamy vanilla, cinnamon and cloves and citrus...very nice finish that leaves wonderful coverage. Great beer Kevin.

thanks to stine for this one.
well, it looks like a hefe: hazy yellow w/ a frothy head. But the flavor is a nice take. lots of banana and citrus flavors with a dry finish.

12-oz. Thanks, Theisti! Super cloudy dark amber with bright coppery highlights. Towering rocky white head and dense rings of lace. Huge banana and bubble gum nose. Creamy, fizzy body. Lots of banana and bubble fum on the mid-palate. Dry, almost bitter finish. Another shockingly great triumph from NG. Not shocking because you dont think they can do it, shocking because you dont think anyone can get these kinds of results from the style. Fantastic stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2010 12oz bottle. Poured a lovely hazy orange color. The head was tall, off white, and foamy with good retention and lacing. Great looking beer. The aroma wasnt half bad, either. Clove, lime, flowery hops, and hints of vanilla, alcohol, and banana seduced my olfactory lobe. And just when I thought it couldnt get any better, I took a drink. Creamy, medium bodied mouth feel. A bit chalky too. Delicately sweet, but mildly bitter as well, peaking at about 3-4 out of 10 on the bitterness indicator. I tasted lots of citrus (lime, lemon, orange), but there was also cereal grain, spices (most notably clove), and a splash of alcohol. Excellent. I had my second bottle of this on 6/15/08 and its holding up well thus far.

12 oz bottle from iowaherkeye; Thanks Joey! Nose of citrus, banana, cotton candy, and a piney turpentine note; cloudy golden orange with a medium glass-lacing off-white head; flavor of peppery spices, cloves, and light hop bitterness; finish is light banana, spiciness, and light bitterness; very different mix and very excellent!

12 ounce bottle from Ughsmash.  Beautiful beer.  Murky. Deep orange in the middle with yellow edges.  Thick, eggshell white head with plenty of lace.  The aroma comes off citrus peel hops.  A bit of clove peeks through.  Some alcohol as well.  The flavor is quite hoppy as well.  Citrus and pine oil.  Clove and pepper.  Full/med body.  Oily.  Dry finish.  A little warm.  Good beer, yet I feel disappointed.  Dancing Man is a much better beer in my mind.

Courtesy of Ughsmash. Pours a cloudy golden color with a tight fizzy white head. Has excellent lacing. Aroma is mostly citrus and bubblegum. Tastes of candied sugar, little earthy hop, citrus fruit, with some funkiness. Finishes with a sweet pepper taste on the tongue. Carbonation is light, and blended with a noticeable alcohol taste.

Aroma is warm and spicy: lemon, grapefruit, and cloves.  Hazy orange color with lots of pillowy foam.  Tastes like bubblegum and oranges.  FInish is oddly hoppy.  Sweet throughout with a little resiny aftertaste.  Smells and tastes even more like bubblegum as it warms.  Very good, very complex, very drinkable.

3-12-08 bottle shared with lb4lb thanks to the great drewbeerme!!! 

Great thick orange pour: cloudy as hell with great lasting white head with superhero lacing.  Smell is actually complex and intriguing.  It has the distinctive hefeweizen smell but has a nice hoppy citris backdrop too.  Flavor is developed and balanced - it has a nice mixture of the hefe yeast flavor with some great hops and citris notes in there as well.  It is nice to pick up a sweet lemon flavor and not have it resemble Lemon Pledge or 409.  Mouthfeel is stellar - thick and creamy with a perfect amount of carbonation.  For a style I cant normally stand - this is the best hefeweizen I have had without a doubt!

finish is crisp, citrusy, and wheaty.

Thanks to decaturstevo for sharing this one.
Pours a cloudy gold with a tall, creamy long-lasting white head.  Laces nicely.
Estery with bananas, spice, clove and citrus.
Sweet start, then comes a tart wheat bite before the smooth sweet finish.
Very smooth and creamy palate.

12oz bottle-A hazy yellowish-orange with a nice big tight head and an aroma of yeast, citrus, clove, and some banana. Starts out with banana, clove and hops. These flavors stay throughout and on the back end it finishes with a nice dryness. A great tasting brew.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of drewbeerme.  Pours a hazy dark golden color (w/ a little amber) and a good sized frothy yellowish head.  The aroma was big and bold with cloves, citrus and pine hops, banana, and yeast.  The flavor is big cloves, citrus hops, yeast, banana, some pepper, and a decent malt base.  This was definetly enjoyed now.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2008 bottle (thanks to devon for picking some of this up for the chicago gang)...... pours a light golden opaque brown wit a fluffy off-white head that sustains for quite some time...... enticing aroma of banana and sweet tropical fruit hops.  it reminded me of a banana pineapple smoothie. well almost maybe..... flavors were quite nice as well. more pineapple and tropical fruits, bananas, some yeasty breadiness, and spice. mouthfeel was soft and creamy..... another winner from new glarus.

12 oz bottle
Again thanks go to Jason for sending a few of these.  Unlike the previous one I plan on laying down a couple to see how this one will age.  To me it was a little fresh and could do with some time.  Currently it tastes like a juiced up version of the Copper Kettle Weiss.  All in all another solid entry in the (so far) outstanding line of Unplugged beers.
Aroma / Appearance - A half finger head rested above the cloudy rust tinted body for a while before deciding to settle.  It was hard to tell if anything was going on but I did detect a slight trace of carbonation.  The scent of spicy banana bread made from very ripe fruit covers up the orange floor polish.  This was not as complex as I was expecting which was a bit of a letdown.
Flavor / Palate - The first sip unfolded a slight bitterness that contained banana, orange creamsicle and oak chips.  They sat on the tongue for a minute or two before the dry finish began to appear.  Overall it was a nice creamy blend of aggressive German wheat flavors.  This was not my favorite but I wouldnt mind popping one of these open at some point in the future to see how ages has treated it.

Courtesy TheCheeseMan.  Glowing tangerine color, tight layer of light tan head.  Looks nice and thick.  Ton of clove on the aroma, some bubblegum, pepper.  Spicy and intense.  Spicy wheat taste, some white pepper flavors on the finish.  Another great wheat brew from New Glarus.

shared by Dickinsonbeer.   Hazy light orange in color with a long lasting white head.  Aroma: citrus, spicy clove, lemon, light banana, and a good amount of wheat.  Taste is weird, but in a good way with cascade hops (grapefruit) alot of tangy wheat, light banana esters and spice, some light pils sweetness and bready yeast. Hop bitterness becomes moderate in the finish and lingers nicely, along with spice, and some tangy wheat.   This was unlike any wheat beer Ive had, yet I really enjoyed this one.  Thanks Paul!

Pours a hazy orange bronze with a nicely-lacing froth of white head.  Floral aroma of fresh citrusy lemony hops with some ground black pepper and clove spice.  Body starts fairly full and lightly sweet with a big citric hop character and some bready German yeasty notes before a slightly drier peppery clove finish with some mild warmth.  A pretty nicely done brew buit not as good as their other German wheats simply because I dont care as much for the intense lemony hop presence.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a large off white head. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of cloves, banana, pine and hops. Taste of hops, cloves, malt and fruit. Medium body with a dry, spice, lighty bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2008 bottle courtesy of drewbeerme
In a word, Wow.
Pours a gorgeous cloudy glowing light orange do deep burnt orange with an everlasting meringue like white head.  Smell is fantastic.  Best smelling hefeweizen ever...Huge fruity, banana notes, mild clove, and a big burst of citrusy fruits and orange with a blast of hops behind that.  Taste is rich and wheaty with noticeable and uncharacteristic hop presence that works so well with this adding a really unique dimension to it.  Nice citrusy bitter orange rind hoppy flavor in the middle followed by a clovey flavor in the finish.  Really complex for the style and unbelievable good and drinkable.  I would never have expected to like a hefeweizen this much.  A must try!!

Pours a cloudy yellow color with a thich and creamy white head.Aromas of bananas,candy, and some clove. Flavor is of bananas, candy,and yeast and just a nice hint hop bite...very interesting! Nice banana and candy aftertaste.Thanks Brewblackhole!
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2008 Total love from first sip. Hopped hefe. Very, very complex,  and delicate for an Imperial. Beautiful look and nose. Best wheat beer Ive ever consumed.

12oz bottle 4th New Glarus Bottle of the Night.  Shared with my Girlfriend Cyn.  Bottle from Motortoddhead.  Ive always been psyched about Unplugged Beers and after having Dancing Man, Im guessing this will be pretty damn tasty.  Pours cloudy yellowed orange with a 2 finger puffy tan head.  Nose is divine, sweet, wheaty, fresh and bold.  Taste is sweet and big with some spiced notes in it, Very nice beer, the spices come through a bit too much for me, but its damn tasty.

Pours glowing and golden, but thick and hazy; an indefinitely lasting, creamy and rich layer of foam leaves a film of steamed milk lace up the side.  Couldnt look more perfect.  Aroma is lively with hop resin and tropical fruit, offering an interesting counterpoint to the spicy sweetness of cinnamon, banana, and bubblegum; somewhat doughy, but refreshing and intricate.  Flavor at first is a lot of acid and red spice, then dried out with citrus peels and barren cascade resins; a syrupy sweetness of cotton candy and honey.  Crisp cloves and gummy yeasts are steadfast throughout.  Mouthfeel is creamy, generous and somewhat dense; medium to full in body, crisp, dry, and very soft.  A waft of heated floral perfume in the very dry and lightly bitter finish.  A wonderfully creative, unique offering, if not something to be compared against a more classically confined hefeweizen like Weihenstephaner; the routes it takes that are different or unexpected lead to some nice surprises throughout.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2009 Well, as usual this is a very interesting beer.  Dan Carey truly is a master at his craft.  This one pours like a typical Hefe, though with a much more substantial looking body.  A cloudy, glowing tangerine color is crowned by a massive, billowing head of whipped egg whites.  The foam lasts for ages, leaving thick rings of lacing on the glass.  The signature Hefe aromas of banana, clove, and nutmeg are all there, but the kicker is a seriously bitter, dry, grassy hop kick.  It smells like a Hefe/IPA half-n-half.  Flavors follow those same guidelines, with the dry hops and wheat really balancing out the malty sweetness and sharp citrus notes.  Finishes with lingering bitterness on the tongue.  Medium-full bodied, it stays dry and doesnt get sticky at any point.  This is about as good as it gets for a Hefe (if thats what we are really calling it).  Ultimately, it falls just a hair short of the masterpiece that is Dancing Man, but its damn good nonetheless.  This brew laughs at other Hefeweizens.  Drink this fresh!  It will never be better than it is right now.

Pours a very hazy honey amber with large amounts of white head that very quickly dissipates. Aroma is of orange, yeast, banana, cloves. Flavor is of cloves, yeast, banana, hops---spicey. Palate is light not heavy but not watery, fairly crabonated....livens the tastebuds. This is a fab Imperial Weizen....much love to New Glarus Brewing.

Bottle pours a very hazy, murky light orange amber.  Large quickly dissipating white head.  Huge spicy aroma with clove, orange peel and a little apple pie. Flavor is more mainstream citrusy.  Like a fresh, low IBU IPA.  Then as it fades the classic Germain Hef yeast and spices come back.  Light and soft palate, very lively.  Very interesting and quite good.  Definately not shy.
Thnaks BuckeyeBoy fopr sharing your trade.

Bottle:  Dusty blonde pour with a large, fluffy white head.  Lemony and spicey aroma, cloves.  Cinnamon comes through after some devoted sniffing.  Smooth blend of citrus and spice, bits of clove.  Nice and crisp.  Full bodied.  A winner here.  Thanks BuckeyeBoy!

12oz Bottle With a big from kmeves for sending this one. Pours out a hazy gold topped with a very small white head. A very nice aroma of Banana, Spice and Clove. Tast is great it has the Hef tast with a kick of hops. Very nice.

I agree with the other raters that this really is not a classic hefe.  Much stronger and hoppier than I expected.  Spicy aroma and flavor.  Dense, smooth longlasting head.  A very, very good brew. Couldnt detect a heck of a lot of wheat.

As someone who thinks New Glarus makes some of the best wheat beers in the world, I wasnt that into this one.  Loads of bitter hops, and so much of them the wheat is hardly perceivable.  More like a double ipa than a hefeweizen.  Fairly spicy but not so much the typical weizen flavors, but rather from hops.

Bottle.  A lovely beer - hazy orange amber body with a big dense head.   Grapefruit flesh, alcohol spice, and soft sweet wheat in the aroma.  Cascade hops dominate the flavor with light banana & clover over a very clean wheat base.  In the end the hops dont mesh that well with the hefe elements - its the combination of yeast spicing and citrus that doesnt work well for me.  Kudos though to the creative beer.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2008 Pours a hazy straw color with thick white head that fades quickly.  Aroma is bubblegum, cinnamon, citrus hops and a bit of alcohol noses through.  Taste is much the same.  There is a bit of a struggle in this beer, and the fight is between is between a hefeweizen and a pale ale.  No one wins out in the fight, but both flavors are noticed.  A bit chewy for a hefeweizen.  This beer should almost be thrown into the "American Strong Ale" as all of the other misfits of beer.  Anyway, rant aside, this is a great beer if you dont expect it to taste like a everyday hefeweizen.  I thought it was good, but not great the first time I had it, but the second bottle is making me thirst for more!

Pours a hazy orange.  Aroma is dynamite, with cloves leading the attack, followed by hops and some citrus, perhaps even a touch of bubble gum.  The flavor is spicy, with a slight nutmeg note coming through, finishes with a refreshing hop bitterness.  Very nice.

Bottle and served in my Ayinger weizen glass: The beer pours a hazy golden amber hue with a huge frothy head and outstanding lace upon the glassware.  WOW what a nose on this beer! Resiny and citric hops jump out at you then there are some of the classic esters of banana and clove. I also found an interesting smoked and iodine vapour too.  The taste is quite bitter and juicy up front with the soft grains almost an afterthought. Very spicy and chalky dry as well on the finish. The mouth feel is quite aggressive and biting missing some of the refreshment associated with the genre, a noticeable smack of alcohol around the edges.  All in all it is indeed a different beast and very much a hybrid beer. Lacks the finesse of the Schneider & Brooklyner Hopfen-Weisse however, only moderately recommended.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2008 Pours a cloudy medium oak color with a typical hefe large head.  Soda-pop like carbonatiion when first poured in glass.  While trying to sniff this I notice that it stings my eyes.  Maybe from the high carbs and the hop oils.  Whatever it is irritating, literally.  

Aroma is mostly west coast hops with a bananna bread background.  Taste is an APA with some bread qualities to it.  Dry on the tongue.  The spices, if any, are lost in the hops, perhaps some clove at the end since it is such a strong spice but you really have search for it and then it could just be a suggestive sense from reading the description.  Although licking your lips you do get some spice after drinking half a glass.

Better than Dancing Man, which I did not like at all, and not knowing the ABV of this considering it is an "Imperial" I could not detect any alcohol, which I like in a hefe as I think the inherently high carbonation makes the  ABV much more noticable than in other styles.

This is a beer drinkers quandry.  Is it all fad and no substance much like a Stephan King novel or no fad and all substance like a William Faulkner.  Personally I tend to think this is more King than Faulkner, to much Cascade.

Poured cloudy with a decent head.  Aroma of banana, cloves and citrus.  Good flavor, hoppy bit, spice, and clove and citrus.  Good creamy feeling.  Very complex.  Thanks to whoever brought this one to the beer barons. I really like this one!

Big thanks to Joe for hooking me up with a bottle of this.  Sampled by a few employees,  thanks man.  Pours a cloudy gold with a thick white head.  Immediate citrus and fruit aroma with a clove background.  Flavor is similar with a nice hop character,  a bit of banana,  and some spice.  A bit too carbonated,  rather creamy (odd).  No hint of the alcohol.  Not my style at all but different enough and drinkable.

Bottle @ Coles Buffalo NY. Pours a cloudy orange/golden. Aroma of amped up banana, clove & booze. Almost spritzy. Nice cramy carbonated body. Alcohol sizzles on your tongue like those spacerocks when you were a kid. Nice flavorful hefe with a kick

Poured cloudy yellow with a large head. Aroma - clove, banana and citrus. There was an immediate and pronounced hoppy bitterness with some spicy and peppery notes along with the typical clove and citrus. It was more bitter than I expected. Mouthfeel was quite thick and creamy. Also a surprise. Very complex. It reminded a lot of Schneider and Brooklyner Hoppen-Weisse.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2008 Thanks a lot to Mark for giving me a bottle and sharing it at other times. Hazy medium orange body that approaches amber. There is a creamy tan yellowish head on top. Now for the fun part. The aroma is strong clove and bananas. This makes me think of peach schnapps. The taste is like biting into fresh cloves at the same time as a fresh peach. There is also some banana pudding and almonds. This is nothing like a real German style hefe, but its still pretty good. Best drank in small doses as it is intense. Its great with a small sample, but if you drink too much, it gets cloying.

Hazy golden orange color with an unbelievably big, fluffy head.  Aroma of cloves, bananas and hops.  Taste is crisp wheat and a honey sweetness with a malt and hops backbone.  Thick and full-bodied with a nice long finish.  Outstanding.

Pours to a great sparkling pillowy soft head that really shimmers in the light. Great gold color with a nice haze to it that makes it look delicious. Recedes to a millimeter thick head with some lacing. Smells of banana, bubble gum, small amounts of hops and cinnamon. Taste is much like the Dancing Man Wheat with a hops kick to it. Another impressive one from New Glarus

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2009 New Glaruss string of disappointing entries in its Unplugged series ends with this baby.  Its very tripel-ish, yet with a wheat backbone that sets it apart.  Pours with a massive, scultpable French-vanilla-colored head, with ridges and valleys that would do the topography of Colorado proud.  Color is hazy orange.  The aroma is clove, with lots of clove and spice and detectable wheat notes in the first tasting, followed by some bitter apricot.  Full and round in the mouth.  Clean but not light on the fnish.  Wonderful beer.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2008 12oz bottle courtesy of mtjoseph and sobo. Huge sweet weiss aroma of clove, banana, bubblegum, spice, hops, yeast. Damn. massively complex for a hefe. Pours a cloudy dark copper with a large, billowing white  head leaving decent lacing. Lots of spice and fruity esters on the palate. Lemon zest, clove, banana esters. Cinnamon. A good amount of unique juniper and pine notes as well. Quite full bodied for a hefe. Excellent carbonation. Creamy. Finishes with an excellent cinnamon and clove spiciness.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2008 12oz bottle. pours hazy golden with fluffy white head. a big hoppy aroma of bubblegum, fruit, spice, and herbal balanced well with banana and clove. great aroma. flavor has many of the same notes but is rather bitter and takes away from the wheat and makes this not so refreshing and drinkable. spicy hop finish. a nice brew however and blows Southern Tiers Heavy Weizen away.

Cloudy golden colored with a huge slightly off-white head. Aroma is huge clove and less pine, wheat, mint and citrus. Flavor is sweet fruit, lemon, pine, grapefruit and pale malts. Somewhat sticky texture, long lemony finish. Yet another great "Unplugged" beer from New Glarus. Well done!

12oz bottle, no date.  Hazy orange with a 1 1/2 finger off-white head, good retention.  Aroma is very fruity--lemon zest, orange zest, and bananas--with some clove, white pepper, cinnamon--Ive only gotten that in a handful of hefes--, and light spicy alcohol in the background.  They have a very accurate description for this.  Flavor has the same fruitiness with some added vanilla notes.  The hops do a mighty fine job of keeping the sweet ness at bay--and then some.  Bitterness peaks around a 3-4.  Bone dry finish--the alcohol adds to the dryness.  Burps with the piney citrus of a good APA.  This has to be at least 8% ABV--nice and warming.    Full body with moderate carbonation.  This beer is fantastic, and makes me rethink not being a fan of Cascades.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: 12oz bottle, courtesy of Ughsmash.  Thanks, Jason!  Pours a cloudy, brownish-orange color; huge, textured off-white head with great retention and lacing that coats the glass; excellent head retention; excellent pour.  Plenty of clove, complex yeastiness, and bananas in the aroma; on the dry side, thankfully; none of the sticky sweetness of other imperial hefes; citrus and wheat.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: lively carbonation and citrus acidity at the front; significantly more sticky sugar, chewy malt than the aroma suggests; solid citrus and mineral bitterness trying to balance things out; the chewiness ends up weighing this down as the glass empties: generous German hefe, but I honestly think this would be significantly improved (to the degree of Dancing Man Wheat, which was phenomenal) if the "imperial" aspect was removed.  Overly sticky core, but generous and tasty otherwise; clear expression of a big, bad hefeweizen.  Lengthy finish, showing sticky candy sugar, cloves and chewy bananas; some lingering sweetness.

Provided by kmweaver. Opaque pale/orange body with a small white head. Sugary cotton candy and honey nose with golden fruits and spicy yeast. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly tart and lightly bitter with tons of clove, cotton candy, banana, peach, orange, floral hops and cinnamon. Medium/full body is round with biting carbonation.

Murky yellow beer with an attractive cream colored head the filled up the space available in my weizen glass.  Sharp nose with the banana clove you are supposed to get from the German Hefeweizen, but with sugar and cinnimon on top and a much more forward pine resin.  I shouldnt read other peoples reviews first, but I completely get the new carpet smell Buckybeer mentioned.  Wow, this is an odd beer.  There is a strong clove, cinnimon and banana weizen under a veritable pine forest.  The hops fight for dominance in this beer, with candied grapefruit rind, warm orange juice and apricot, but the cloves win out in the end.  This is an oddly schizophrenic beer that really works well to my tastes.  This appeals to my hop head nature and my affinity to German Hefes all in one glass.  Many thanks to Ughsmash for this great little treat.
Pours cloudy orange/amber with a medium white head.  Nice aroma of banana, floral hops, orange and yeast.  Taste is cinnamon, citrus, banana, bubblegum and bready yeast.

Many thanks to Skyview for carting this back during a blizzard for us.  Hazy yellow color with a large head.  Aroma almost like an IPA made with Noble hops.  Very floral and some yeastiness.  Wow... tastes like a yeasty, bready, wheat smoothie.  Lots of banana.  A little black pepper.  Excellent!

Courtesy of Skyview.  Hazy golden pour with a finger thick white head.  Citrusy hop aroma mixed with light wheat.  Nice mixture of hops and malt in the taste.  Very well balanced.  The wheat comes through and melds into the hops.  Very nice.

Pours a very cloudy golden with a huge head. Pretty big carbonation. Aroma is big hops, clove, citrus, bananna and sort of a new carpet smell. Flavor is very unique. Blasts of hops, citrus, pine, spice, bananna. It seems like each time you take a drink it is a rush of something different. Finish is sharp and bitter. This is Dancing Man on HGH!!!!

Pours a very hazy orange-gold color with a medium frothy white head and lots of bubbly lacing.  Aroma is intense - clove, some bitter hops, orange, banana, yeast, and wheat.  The taste is about the same with a focus on wheat, banana, and clove.  It’s very refreshing and reminds me a lot of Golden Monkey.  I would have liked to see this as a slight variant of Dancing Man with its great wheat taste but this is in a totally different realm.  Less sweet with more wheat would have made it perfect.

Bottle pours a very hazy yellow gold with a white head to the top of my tulip.  I gave it a proper yeast pour - not letting that go to waste.  It looks really good.  Nice lace as the head drops.  The aroma is fresh hops, clove, banana, orange, yeast, and just overall perfect (add in a touch of bubble gum as it warms).  Flavor is so multi-dimensional that Im not sure what hit me first.  Sitting here Im sort of struck by this fine creation.  The multi-dimensional characteristics sort of occur simultaneously.  Up front I taste a dry malt, but then the hops seem to be right there, clove and banana, orange, cinnamon, yeast (sort of Belgian like), and a hop linger.  The palate suits well as a solid foundation to support such flavor.  This is a fine brew folks.  Dont let this one get by you.  Well worth the drive to Hudson from the West Metro.

Pours to a really hazy orange caramel colored body with lots of visible carbonation.  A really tall, foamy/frothy off-white head with awesome lacing sits on top.  The aroma has lots of sweet fruity hops, notably oranges and light lemons.  Amongst that, a deep caramelized wheat.  Reminds me of the Bells Wheat Series, only hoppy!  The flavor is wheat, light cloves and bubblegum, orange slices, and earthy bread yeasts.  A dash of sweet caramel to boot.  The palate is sweet, really carbonated, too earthy, and lightly drying.  (REALLY yeasty)

Picked up a four-pack of 12-oz bottles at Bob McFarland Liquors in McFarland, Wisconsin. Pours a semi-hazy golden amber brew with a thick and lumpy white head that has some excellent lacing and sticky bubbles throughout. Aroma of sweet grapefruit zest, cloves, yeast, a touch of banana, and multi-grain malt with wheat. Taste is quite the flavor. Medium to full bodied, light carbonation with flavors of sweetened multi-grain malt, mandarin oranges, a touch of banana esters and cloves, with some tart raisin. Finish is slightly high alcohol warmth, a mild bitterness that quickly covers up with flavors of banana and cloves. Most excellent.

(bottle) Pours hazy orange with a large white head that sticks around.  This aroma is just great, it varies so much. One sniff Ill get a large dose of banana, another time Ill get just pure citrusy hops (more specifically, mandarin orange and grapefruit peel), and another sniff will yield clove and cinnamon with yeast.  The taste is very good as well, and the banana begins things, but then switches to cinnamon and clove, and ends to a nice yeasty/wheat finish.  Then the hops assert themselves and youre left with a lingering bitterness on the tongue.  Really full, chewy mouthfeel.  Wow, this is just excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2008 [Bottle] Pours hazy orange with a good sized off-white head.  Aroma is citrusy hops, banana, cloves and yeast.  Each time I smell it the balance between these changes, but its always very powerful and nice. Taste is bitter up front, then it quickly changes to banana and clove before going back to the citrusy bitter finish with only a hint of quickly fading banana. Smooth, with a good, thick mouthfeel. Finish could be a little longer. A unique and very enjoyable beer.

Heavy cream and banana,and what the heck is that,at first I thought it was kindergaten glue,but then bam it was Cascade hops, what a strange combination,taste was a blast of the banana, tart wheat, a notice of sidewinding alcohol, and the piney flavor of the hops, slight carbonic bite as the yeast really pumped out the co2 here.Cant get over the extremely fresh hop and banana combination in that aroma. Im not absolutely sure its all coming together,but how interesting

pours a cloudy dark yellow-almost orange with a slight head. Has a nice yeast , hop and citrus aroma. Thick and very smooth on the palate. Starts out with a mild citrus taste followed by a nice yeasty flavor typical of good weizen beers. Ends nicely with a blend the hops and yeast flavor. Brings back memories of my weekends at the Essen House in Madision WI....ahh the good old days!

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2008 Pours a cloudy orange gold with a good sized off-white head. Big aroma of bananas, clove, spices, and citrus. Nice sweetness, a little more hop aroma is noticed as I take my first sip. Solid bitterness, but not too much. Sort of like an IPA/hefe mix. Excellent, grab some of this while the aroma is fresh if you can. Update - 3/23/08 - I put a couple in the basement to see how theyd change. I notice a lot more bubblegum in the aroma. The spices and clove are still there, but the banana aroma has decreased. The hops are still there, the whole aroma is a little weaker. The whole aroma profile seems to have changed. If I was rating this for the first time today, I dont think Id give it a 4.4 again, probably a 4 or 4.1. Still very good, but not the experience it was fresh. Doesnt taste anything like a German Hefeweizen should if that is what anyone is expecting.

Bottled.  Poured hazy, medium orange with a tall, well-retained cap of off-white head.. just what I wanted to see!  The aroma picked up huge doses of cloves and deep banana upfront, backed by citrus and perfumey hoppage.. odd marriage of big green hops in a heavy wheat beer, but I really dug it.  The flavor had heavy darker banana and pale malts at the base, with pine and citrusy hops and lots of clove around the edges.. felt strong at the end, but the alcohol was never overt.. this was just really good!  Medium-plus bodied on the palate with delightful fluffy carbonation that rolled over the tongue.. spices play well with the yeast and big hoppage.  Excellent experiment!

Bottle opened with a rush of carbonation.  Pours cloudy orange with a fluffy and carbonated off white head.  As I pour that familiar banana and clove aroma is very pronounced.  I do detect a slight hop presence in the nose, a hint of pine.  The taste is something all together new almost like weiss part and cascades are fighting with each other.  Sometimes I taste the cloves and bananas and yeast and other times the hops.  Both seem present in the finish.  Bitter finish with some sweetness.  Very unique and interesting brew.  I found myself eagerly wanting to know what I would taste in the next sip.

Cloudy golden colored liquid. Huge, lasting, off-white head. As close to whole cloves in a brew I have yet to encounter. Amazing scent of cloves, pine and citrus. Hints of wheat and malt along with some menthol, bubblegum  and cinnamon. Over the top weiss aromas, they are all there and either at times overpowering or just hanging around waiting for the your nose to recover from the onslaught. Sweet pine sap start leads to grapefruit and pale malts. Finish and linger are quite sharp with lemon zest and a touch of peach pit along with some dry spice. The linger is dry and nearly to bitter for me, as my mouth starts to feel as if it is packed with dry herbs and hops. Love the aroma and everything up to the linger. so if I drink this quickly and nonstop it is nearly perfect.  An original and quite amazing effort once again from Dan and New Glarus Brewing Co. As it warms the finish and linger do not seem as sharp or perhaps my mouth is numbing. Based on the O.P. this has to be near 7%, yet no alcohol is remotely noted. I think the description is right in that the time is now, yet I wonder if it will mellow like an aged Aventinus.
